Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2 eggs over easy, sausage patties, breakfast potatoes and Oreo cakes

5uGU4Xi3FSHsOxKZ12JK3Q.text: California Scrambler is the best!!  And I rarely eat pancakes but probably the best I have ever tried. Love that butter syrup!!

hYMcPI8VQpoPSXB0EeHZGA.text: My mom, boyfriend, our baby, and myself went to try this place out for the first time today for Mother's Day. Although it was very busy, they brought out food out very quickly and everything About this place was spectacular! The service was great, everyone was so friendly. The food was delicious- a little upset I didn't get to take pictures of it. The atmosphere there is very welcoming and also very kid friendly. Definitely will be going back. Their banana pancakes and hash browns are to die for!

R6m04w6yxjuZXhcJ75K-xA.text: Always good. This is one of my favorite places for breakfast and brunches. The only negative side? The waiting time, especially on Sundays around 10-11 am where all the Scottsdale population reunites for brunch. Fortunately they have a very efficient method: they take your name and phone number and notify you once your table is ready. So take my advice: go there and put your name down, then go do something else in the waiting time and come back when you get the call. This is less stressful that just get frustrated with an empty tummy.   Once you finally sit down then it's all fun time. The menu is amazing with plenty of options including sides. Coffee is good and freshly brewed and the service is quick. You can either sit inside or outside. Again, I'll come back here a million times if I can. Of course, if this place was a little bit bigger that would eliminate the waiting list issue. ;-)

VIP64GuVg5z4ST68OhONsA.text: Seriously, BUTTERS is one of the best breakfast spots my ass has ever been to, easily. Got there on a Friday and it was packed, imagine the weekends are crazy x 10. Got in and checked the menu.   I ordered the banana creme cakes, and it was the best pancake I've ever had by a country mile. Thick and fluffy cakes topped with bananas, graham cracker crumbs and a creme sauce. About two-thirds a way into it, I thought to myself, "damn, self, you didn't even put syrup on this." Didn't need it. It was so outstanding, I'm thinking about my next trip to Scottsdale already.   A breakfast game changer.   A+, 5 stars.

E2Dfza11vY5NoeCJZW13HQ.text: Great fresh food.. excellent service and great atmosphere. Nice patio too with misters.

ZSNrPhnQboToy1dBMYl-Sw.text: The absolute hands down best breakfast place to exist. I've been coming here for a year and a half now and it is like nothing else. I'm not sure if it's the perfect pancakes every time or if it's the crispy but not too crispy hash browns but it is to die for....  Or the fresh squeezed OJ is AMAZING or the fact that every time the service is ON POINT! I don't know what else to say honestly except come try it yourself because it's THAT GOOD

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild berry Pancakes

Hf2o3fbiPN5szTGLg53-ng.text: So many great reviews by my fellow Yelpers and this place does not disappoint. We decided to go for breakfast after pulling an all-nighter last weekend reached around 6:25 and I kid you not there were people waiting already.  We choose to sit inside but they have a beautiful patio that gets filled up by 7:00 I am relieved when a restaurant is filling up quickly just says a lot about the place.  ~ Banana cream cakes (stack of 3) $9 (Fresh bananas & cream, graham cracker pecan crumb & caramel) ~ Veggie Omelette $10  (tomato, onion, mushroom, green pepper, cheddar cheese) Each additional item .25 ~Classic Brioche $8 you can add a Fruit for $1.99 ~ Iced Americano $3  Great Food and Ambience The only reason I stop at 4 stars is the service it could be friendlier. I'd rather see smiling faces, especially in the morning.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside seating
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced coffee $3
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana cream cake $9

-KkXmFqfUe2bTm0nBzlq3Q.text: So I have been here 3 times now over a 2 year span. Today I had the Wildberry french toast which is a huge departure from my normal eggs, meat, potatoes, toast. It was really good. My self nor my friends have never had a bad meal. The service has always been really good. By getting there at opening we have never had to wait. Soon they are moving about 1/2 mile North, presumably to a larger place.

xsbpJd1rhldHMv0PPSybbw.text: My boyfriend & I's favorite place for breakfast! We're practically regulars! Great food for a great price & plenty of options to switch up your meal! My favorite is the California Scrambler My boyfriend's is the cinnamon roll pancakes with the whole hog skillet!

I3NebtSwpw5O8RbOZDPvGg.text: My go to breakfast spot. Never disappoints and everything on the menu is delicious. Best pancakes I've ever had. On another note, if you want a good clean out, you will not be disappointed an hour or less later. Could be the oil they use, not sure.

yAdLd44x33h_geFwmsA0dg.text: Wait for it, wait for it, wait some more, there are empty tables, wait for it,wait for it. Hmmm, still empty tables, lots of people outside. Whew... now we can sit.  Finally it is time for the best eggs is Arizona. The pancakes and waffles are tops too. Iced tea, perfection. Hot tea served with honey as expected. Probably the best breakfast in the country! If it weren't for the un-necessary extra wait this would be our new breakfast spot.

l0s_hgEncKNG3WPFjsymXg.text: We're usually very picky people when it deals with food and were impressed with this place. We had the strawberry cheesecake and huevos rojo which came out surprisingly quick, food was delicious. The staff was friendly and attentive and coffee was always full!

T72cHXiN_ixrkXcvS8XWvQ.text: Awesome spot. Best breakfast / brunch spot ever. Really good food. Just takes forever to get a seat since there always so busy. But it's worth the wait. :)

jW6OPal-BUJyorDIgoO6FQ.text: What can I say other than, start the day with Butters!!!  I was on stay-cation in the area and we went to Butters based on yelp reviews.  We went on a weekday morning, the staff was very friendly and all of the employees had a smile on their faces.  You can taste the difference in food when the people making and serving it enjoy what they do.  We decided to split two meals so we could both try more of the flavors this delightful breakfast place had to offer.   We had split a make your own omelet with chorizo, bacon, onion, and red jalapeno..  The flavor of the bacon was not overwhelmed by the chorizo and it wasn't too greasy like you often get with a chorizo omelet.  The eggs were light and fluffy, and made a nice balanced omelet with the ingredients that were chosen.  The hash browns were crispy on the outside and not just mush on the inside.  Great Start!!!  Then for a wonderful finish we split the cinnamon roll pancakes...  It was amazing, the texture was so light and delicate, I was impressed as to how they managed to take an oversized cinnamon roll and flatten it without damaging the fluffy integrity of a delicious roll.  The frosting was great and balanced with hints of citrus.  Everything about our experience was fantastic and our only regret is that it is too far from us!!  This is one of the best breakfast places either of us have ever been to and would definitely return and recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll pancakes!!!  So fluffy and light!!
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Make your own omelet with chorizo bacon onion and red jalapeño!! Very good!

Lfjhk_CjWt-0XJJRsocZzg.text: The Butterfield's brothers have done it again! Butters is everything I look for in a breakfast or lunch spot. It's open and airy, the staff is friendly and fast and the food is fantastic. Oh and did I mention that the patio is dog-friendly? All pluses in my book! Since so many of the reviews are about breakfast, I am going to talk about lunch!  Their wraps are amazing. The tortilla bread is soft and fresh and the combinations are mouthwatering. I ordered the Southwest Veggie Wrap with the addition of turkey. The wrap has Black beans, jalapeno cheese, corn, red bell pepper, avocado, scallion, lettuce, tomato & chipotle mayo. Every bite is better then the one before it. For my side, I splurged and ordered the sweet potato fries. Oh sweet happiness, I am so glad I did! The lunch was heartier than I typically opt for in the middle of the day, but when the food is this good, it doesn't quiet matter as much!   The server was friendly and efficient. In fact, I had only had 1/3 of my Diet Coke and she brought me out a new one! That's service. This is definitely a eatery that shouldn't be missed.

NSvkfZ47OA1m9cBbHdKdeA.text: Excellent food and service. Great eggs and pancakes. Highly recommend! These were some of the best eggs we've had and lots of interesting pancake choices. The bacon was also fantastic!

Z0-uZPJ_Dz8Cc-Pc99jYYQ.text: Amazing banana cream pancakes! Skillet was the best I've had. Crazy busy but worth the wait!

d6Gm_BOPUDChDkKmB3alyA.text: No complaints here.  They have all the bases covered for a good breakfast joint: food, service, menu variety, seating.  Also, they have a lunch menu available (though it is primarily a breakfast spot). Since this seems to be the only solid breakfast restaurant in the immediate area, it gets real busy on weekends.

edft2-1Y13GaVQXJb0Jo6A.text: The freshly squeezed OJ is the best thing here. The breakfast was good but nothing too special. However, I did not have one of the specialty pancakes which i guess they are known for. Quick service.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon, mushroom, onion skillet

OGKb6dBbAS1KrWswHj1qRQ.text: Best breakfast in Arizona! Please skip trendy Original Pancake House (it's really not that good). It is also definitely better than Butterfields (sister restaurant). I ordered the fruit pancakes with marscapone both times I've been. I also tried everyone else's dishes, all of which were great!

6D2z-00zvatue4t_i2Uo1g.text: Butters. That says it all. I went one time with my girlfriend and instantly become a loyal regular customer. Excellent food selection and presentations. Can't get enough of the banana pancakes! Also the manager is fantastic. Greets and jokes with me every time I come in and even offered to buy me breakfast after my card wasn't almost working. Now that's customer service. I highly recommend this place

mJgxusKsD5KT6_TyaHMxbg.text: Simply the finest staff, from mgt to server to bussers that I have ever experienced. Everyone is friendly and well trained. The food Is excellent.  Please come late so I can get a table!!!!!

ORHF4uY7TZGi5SIvp2VuyA.text: Hands down best breakfast food ever, not to mention True fresh squeezed orange juice! !!

OJ9UO7ywQhki7KZt39DFaQ.text: The food is absolutely DELICIOUS and at a very affordable price. The pancakes were amazing - we had both the regular and protein pancakes. Lots of healthy options as well! Eggs/omelette were fluffy and not too greasy. Definitely recommend the hash browns as well! One of the best breakfast spots in the area. Get here early though on weekends the line gets long at peak times!

xaiXKutl8CcANEOWI0TfXw.text: Amazing pancakes! I don't know if they are the best ever but I know that I've never had any that were definitely better. So good. The Mexicana Omelette is my usual. Lots of flavor and pretty original. You can make that meal last all day and it's surprisingly very reasonable in price considering the zip code. Great service too. Nothing bad at all to say.

TWiYEEEOeQQ1o_OQdOnBGA.text: Great Eggs Benedict. I got the Florentine and my gf got a Classic Benedict. Overall good food.

gHvrJjzvgrtEXzMfpVC4ZQ.text: Best breakfast in town.  We have been there many time and enjoy it every time.. They take their eggs and put them through a blender making their omelettes fluffy.

abszbwfPDX29qSPnEVF5pA.text: We had a party of 5 and everyone really enjoyed what they ordered. We would have given it 6 stars if we could. Excellent Eggs Benedict.

CuL0aDSYjZIb4q4Xj2ikHg.text: Whole Hog - good. Orange juice - good. Pancakes - good.  Thick slabs of bacon  - yum!!

KHdNgxJkejQQ8d0xanlOwQ.text: Went here on early Sunday with no wait. The waitress split the check for us without us even asking which was kind. The food there is absolutely amazing and I would recommend. Everything on the menu is so delicious but isn't totally affordable. One thing that irked me was that I was charged a dollar for a side of whipped cream.. Really? It was probably worth a penny. Other than that it is great.

_-55zx92n5EgmFjFieTONA.text: I wish breakfast was for every meal! Because this place is amazing!!!! The fresh squeezed orange juice is so delicious! I had the French toast .... lord have mercy! It's so sweet and savory and delicious! The bacon and the sausage were cooked to perfection! The service was attentive. I just love this place! Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3-znnG85Uj_A8s0FdbdtRw.text: This a elegant breakfast place I have to admit (saw a lambo roar in the parking lot). My attire was totally off. Came straight to this place after a hike and God, shouldn't have done that.  Ordered - Garden Skillet - went with scrambled eggs. Tasted bland but Tabasco helped me enjoy it. No wow factor in particular about this skillet.  Wildberry smoothie - just a regular smoothie.  Why 4 stars for not so mind blowing food? Prolly a 3.5. The ambience man. Top notch. No plasticware. It's all glass / ceramic. Waiters were good enough to check on the table time to time. Presentation was good too.

LbUYWwUTzRA31PYX6mOsaA.text: Best breakfast in AZ.  We could eat here everyday.  Many choices and everything was beyond our expectations.  The staff was incredible.  Friendly informative and made you feel like family.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate chip strawberry pancakes were awesome.

6zokdNtIkMOtcjoxX8VrKQ.text: Stopped in at their Hayden rd. location. Waitress was very attentive and personable. Really liked her. Cream pasta soup was outstanding. Chicken salad sandwich and garden salad were perfect. Not much else to tell you, just go and try it.

tXDapHbMVyG8-y1C_5dt-w.text: Worth the wait!!  Seriously, if you want a place that takes the basics and makes them amazing this is the place to go. Everything was fantastic. My family and I were seated before the told wait time, the seats were appropriate to our group size and our drink order happened right away. Hayden our waitress was amazing with my super hungry and cranky son and even got down on his level to take his order. The food came quickly and was amazing. Simply amazing. The toppings and flavors were what was described and tasted amazing. I personally had the Cinnamon French toast and it was heavenly. The Corn beef has was also perfect.   If you have not tried Butters, you need to. It is a gem and worth every penny and time spent.

B1ZRhXk_No6mT2qsdEVbcA.text: Butters makes living in a desert damn near pleasant. How you ask? Try the Banana Cream Pancakes and get back to me.  I asked for extra bananas because I'm that person.   The service was attentive without being obnoxious, the price point for all the food is great. The corned beef hash was super tasty and that iced coffee ( free refills) so damn good.   My only negative is that it is in Scotsdale, but I am a forgiving reviewer and won't deduct points for that mistake.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana cream pancake (the side option not even the full size, mind blown, right!)

7b3p1HSmqRwj076elSekOg.text: The food and service in this restaurant is amazing! 4 hungry kids, plus my husband and I and we were not disappointed! Hayden, our waitress, was phenomenal. She was on the ball, attentive and fast. She crouched down to take our youngest child's order and made him feel like he was important to her.  The food was incredible! I had the baked potato omlete and it was the best omlete I have ever had! It was also enough to fill me up so I couldn't eat the pancakes or the fruit that came with it! 100% recommend this place.  Plus, Pokemon stops for days

EJRDBYdjtoj1tCkIKn1dlw.text: The Santa Fe Scrambler and the Strawberry Cake on the side were tremendous. The two poached eggs (any style) melded perfectly with the sausage, jalapeno, onion, and cheddar. Not normally a fan of pancakes, but the strawberry/strawberry glaze on top convinced me. So many good options on the menu!  There's still a big wait on weekdays, but it's well worth it. Restaurant rev: sign-up for the Yelp's Wait List feature.  They only seem to have tables for multiple people. I felt bad eating solo at a 4-top because I was wasting space, but the server was super nice and helpful.

Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portion of menu
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry Cakes

aZF2EAiagJi-DKiN-phjaA.text: This adorable restaurant is across the street from my work so I've been many times throughout the years but lately I feel like their food as gotten better! My go to order is the bacon mushroom and onion skillet, and it's delicious. I also love that with an egg dish, you get a side of toast or pancakes! And I almost always upgrade to a speciality pancake, chocolate chip pancakes! They are soooo good and I wish I could just get a huge stack of those instead of eggs but I need some protein for breakfast, right?? I mean look at these pancakes! Seriously, go eat here and you'll thank me later!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. chocolate chip pancakes

LxlwvyaJr0u10x-zprTHaw.text: It's rare that I go out to eat and I am 100% satisfied with every aspect of the experience, but this was one of those times. The server, Hope, was attentive and very nice, even when I made an obnoxiously special order for a latte. My blueberry granola almond pancakes hit the spot perfectly. My husband got the California scramble, which looked awesome, and came with enough food that we probably could have just shared his meal. The place looked great. I may come back tomorrow to try something else!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blueberry granola almond pancakes

0u2AiiVf4WsgnqFP6N18yg.text: Came here for breakfast on a Sunday. I knew the place was relatively new, so I was anticipating a long wait. And wait we did! For nearly 1 hour! The food and service however, was WORTH the wait! I was pleased to see gluten free pancake options, which is not only rare at most breakfast establishments, but notoriously difficult to perfect in the kitchen. These guys nailed it! I had the cinnamon roll gluten free pancake option with the chorizo scramble, and while my digestive tract wasn't a fan of all the rich, high fat goodness, I was in food heaven! The pancakes were rich and moist, and the texture was a glorious work of art.  My husband isn't a fan of waiting to be seated at restaurants, so he kicked and screamed the whole time. I didn't know there was an option to add yourself to the waitlist on Yelp, so I'll do that next time. Either that or come in early, since the place opens before 7am anyway! I will be back. Oh yes. I will be back! 4 stars because of the wait.

aRoY_ybgCZf2VYW-e_U8sg.text: This is a very popular restaurant. The place was packed at 10:00. This is a very well run establishment. The waiters were young, beautiful, pleasant, thorough and fast. The menu is impressive. For me they made a special omelet that was delicious. The servings are large; you won't go home hungry. The tables were bused and turned expediently. I was very impressed.

fdLjsdppnuAZSWVRuEiRFA.text: Summary - Breakfast done right and at an unbeatable price. Come here, get the pancakes and eggs, you will not be disappointed. (Pro tip - use the Yelp waitlist feature it will save you a 30-minute wait and seriously, get the pancakes)          My friend and I were craving brunch last Sunday and decided to splurge on a breakfast out. Having read really positive reviews about this place we decided to go. Upon seeing a 45-minute wait in the Yelp app I joined the waitlist and we hung out until closer to our appointment. While it was a bummer waiting that long for what is surely one of the best breakfasts in the valley, the app nailed the exact wait time.   We already knew what we were going to order when we sat down. I had the two eggs scrambled with bacon, fruit, and a side of pancakes. My friend ordered the same, but with sausage.  The friendly waitress quickly took our order and we waited for our food to arrive. It did not take long! Service was super quick.  The 2 scrambled eggs were super fluffy, almost like they had been whipped for a long time. Absolutely light, airy, and delicious. The bacon was thick cut and had a great crunch to it. Definitely not a microwaved afterthought, but an integral part of the meal. The fruit tasted fresh and my friend who ordered potatoes was happy to report that they were crisp and fried, not greasy and gross.  Now the pancakes were on another level and deserve their own paragraph. Each food order comes with 2 regular pancakes or 2 specialty pancakes (for a little extra).  I ordered the OG normal pancakes and was pleasantly surprised by how light, fluffy, and frankly delicious they were. You have to get the pancakes.  My friend ordered the chocolate chip strawberry variety and was a little disappointed that the chocolate chips were not cooked into the pancakes, but placed on top next to the strawberries. In the end it really did not matter as the flavor combination was out of this world and he quickly devoured them. While the other flavors looked heavy, I am sure they are delicious and trying all of the different items on the menu will give me an excuse to come back!

ExTrABB9bs5EbQgkuVfX7Q.text: Great place for Breakfast, plan ahead because it's ALWAYS busy.  I don't know where to begin...... Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes, Fresh Squeezed orange juice, fluffy omlets with any fresh ingredients. The "hash browns" are sliced round potatoes that are so good & crispy on the edges.  Large polish sausages, thick bacon. This is so good, I'm going back right now..... bye

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Latte! Saturday breakfast.

GxbfB5AD5eqLHiaGeGx4CQ.text: We went to Butters on a Sunday morning for breakfast. Recommend checking in on Yelp prior to going because their lines can get long on the weekends. We went around 915am and only had to wait about 15 min because we checked in on yelp.  I'm Celiac and need gluten-free and they were very accommodating.   They have a drink bar for ordering while you wait and we got a wild berry smoothie, strawberry smoothie and a black coffee. The strawberry smoothie was very flavorful and tasted like it was made from yogurt.  The server was very accommodating and knowledgeable about gluten-free. I wasn't able to do the gluten-free pancakes or waffle because they are done on the same grill and waffle irons, but there were quite a few options on the skillets, omelettes, scrambles, etc.  I went with a Mexicana Omelette but couldn't do the New Mexico Green Chili sauce because it sounded like it wasn't gluten-free. It was still very good and the chorizo flavor was fantastic. My wife got the 2-egg breakfast with sausage, hash browns, and 2 blueberry pancakes. She was happy with her breakfast and said the pancakes were good but the blueberries were just bunched in the middle of the pancakes. Definitely would have been better if they took the time to spread them out a little more evening across the pancakes.   Overall the breakfast was very good, we'll be back for breakfast or brunch sometime soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexicana Omelette (added Chilula) w side of fruit and tomato - without the green chili sauce to make it gluten-free - very good chorizo!
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2-egg breakfast with sausage &amp; hash browns (side of 2 blueberry pancakes in the background)

Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blueberry pancakes - good but blueberries were all bunched in the middle. They should spread them a little more evenly across the pancake.

eQjA0GIHVv_LdrlmDqooWw.text: The pancakes literally bring you joy when you eat them. Best pancakes I've ever had. You must get the ones with berries and stuffed with sweet cream. I can't recall the name. Love these pancakes. The omelet I had was also delicious and the juice is freshly squeezed!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious!! Pancakes with sweet cream and berries. Can&#39;t recall the name.

XDxKMxBxRNjNlYLjTkQTEg.text: Amazing! The environment is classy and clean. The service is quick and efficient. The food was so great! We will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2 eggs with hash browns and bacon with a banana cream pancake

3UivX3cuQpkQCR6Jfz8_eg.text: Truly excellent food and service. I'm a very satisfied regular. Stall well trained and always smiling. The breakfast options are great and never had a bad meal there. I really hate giving this a good review because I don't want to wait for my table

bq6HoXrVBZyHrD0YamLA7A.text: Came here on Sunday for brunch and had what might have been the best omelette I've ever had! Okay so the weekend wait times at this place are pretty horrendous (we waited about an hour with only 2 of us), but I had read the reviews and knew that before coming. Prepare ahead!!! Get on the waitlist through Yelp as soon as you are within five miles of the building. There's shopping nearby and also a nice little park where we waited directly in front of and to the left behind the buildings with benches and a nice little pond. This place is extremely popular so don't expect to walk up and get immediate service on a weekend.  Now let's get to the actual dining experience. The ambiance here is very casual. Our waitress we got was very friendly and efficient. So many items to choose from on the menu but my friend and I both gravitated to the Mexicana omelette. This was probably the best omelette I've had in Phoenix. The chorizo was amazing, the eggs perfectly cooked and fluffy. You've got to try this dish! I opted for the spicy jalapeno cheese and pancakes for my side. Everything was absolutely delicious. The portions were awesome! The price was very affordable! I can see why this place is so popular.  All in all this place is one of the best spots for brunch in the area if you don't mind waiting a bit. Sometimes good things are worth the wait! I will be coming back to try some of their famous pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexicana Omelette

_GoDWRQicNLcIESuZa6qBQ.text: Just your basic breakfast place if ya ask me.... Was pretty packed on a Sunday morning at 9 ish.... We had to wait for 5 min or so. Biscuits and gravy were just okay, the hash browns were also just okay lol. I would probably not be returning, as I feel I can make just as good or even a better breakfast at home   (and for less $$ too )

gz_6BaT4Av2KCcHad4JvEg.text: Amazing pancakes and French Toast. The pancake batter is delicious. Cafe mocha, Oreo and Berry flavors are must get. They also have squeeze their orange juice when you order. Service is great as is the atmosphere.

603J2oc7rq8_DH9zRhU0Eg.text: Good food and good service. They can usually seat you in an reasonable amount of time. You can find inside of outside. Fresh squeezed orange juice us a must.

G74ifV5TDyTKKqKdYd27RQ.text: We've been going to Butter and their other restaurant on Shea.  When Butterfield's changed from making prepared hash Browns, we thought what a mistake.  They make their own, but darn the prepared ones were far superior in taste.  If I am having an omelette, I want Hash Browns that are not only Browned, but I want them hot and crisp. The others cannot compare to these Hash Browns they are making in their own commissary.  These are limp, brown and tasteless.  The Benny is still good, and i ordered fruit instead.  But Hash Browns were our preference.  My husband had the California Scramble and Hash Browns that he left on his plate.  So, I think it's time to try another restaurant that makes delicious Hash Browns that are crisp and better than these, and hopefully the rest of the breakfast will be as good.   The noise level in the new place is pretty bad.  They have nothing in the way of acoustics, so you definitely have a hard time hearing. Our server was very capable and on top of things.  She seemed to know about the Hash Browns and sent over the manager, who basically said they were busy and they were fresh....So, we will move on!

vYbNIPhVkKpKTHPjRm_W0w.text: Always worth the wait! Cheesy grits never fail to amaze and they are always happy to accommodate any request!

vS4gJ23Qq--t4RE8adnmVA.text: if you're in Scottsdale and need a good breakfast or brunch spot, COME HERE! there are some stellar pancake options, and their scramblers and skillets are out of this world. our server let me know that you can get an imperfect as a scrambler, and that's what I did! mine had chorizo, avocado, verde sauce and pepper jack. it came with 2 pancakes and hashbrowns! soooo goooood. service was wonderful, the food was REALLY good, and it was all incredibly reasonably priced. we will be back next time we're in town!

F0Q7tPbpF8jCTJMlU_-GdQ.text: Despite the 45 minute wait, the food was awesome, and they bring food very quickly after ordering. They have a very full menu, so there's bound to be something for everyone!   The crepes were very light and fluffy, and the banana creme sauce was delightful. The omelettes are hearty and cooked to perfection! Overall, very yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Omelette with potatoes and banana creme crepe (below)

pqrpmk2sU7Pg8_XFwprgcg.text: Great selection of quality lunch and breakfast items. My favorite is their salads. A bit pricey.

J9ydQjN5Rps95JDlzBY5mQ.text: Two part review:   Food. Was wonderful. Pancakes were absolutely delicious. Maybe the best I've ever had although Liberty Market in Gilbert are outstanding. The whipped butter on the cakes was to die for. The eggs look a little strange but trust me, try them they were amazing as well.   Ambiance/ noise level: almost couldn't be worse. The noise level inside is intolerable. No exaggeration it is easily as loud as a club. This is one of the noisiest restaurants I've ever been in. We HAD to go outside. I think we would have had to leave if outside wasn't an option.  Suggestion: please get noise reducing panels or something, anything, to reduce the noise. It ruins the dining experience.

01zc0THGOcnMuKGIM8el1g.text: My husband and I recently ate here. The poached eggs were not done. The whites were super runny. My skillet was so greasy I actually got sick in their restroom before we left. It is the cutest place but we won't be back.

nXzpPzZOEjmit_FKYXWMnA.text: Great French Toast, coffee, service,and many breakfast and lunch options.Waffles and pancakes are delicious as well. Be prepared for a long wait on weekends.Worth it.

X1sMf5azzc7qlXKI98ejrg.text: When the server arrived with my breakfast, I was like that German guy staring at the Ark of the Covenant in Indiana Jones - I wanted to look away but couldn't - it was just that beautiful.  It was like Martha (fucking) Stewart stood at the doorway between the seating area and kitchen personally inspecting each plate for even the smallest of details, making sure each plate was perfect.  Omelets are huge, fluffy and bright yellow with no brown. Hash browns are large slices, like potato chips; just as thin and golden brown. Grits are as white and beautiful as Anderson Cooper's butt cheeks in the winter. (conjecture) And the pancakes. Ah, the pancakes.  Dusted with powdered sugar in a way that only my mother could make.  The real triumph in all of this are the grits.  I'm thinking the calorie count has to be equal to the square root of infinity but who cares, god bless america, the chef, Martha (fucking) Stewart, my waitress and anyone else who had a hand in these natural wonders.  I see myself ordering buckets of grits for takeout, going home and eating them until I shoot grit shrapnel out of my ass like an exploding space nebula. I'd aim at the neighbors dog - Casper. I hate that little fucker.

TWn8TbgKrF10VxHD8NiCjw.text: This place has amazing food and costumer service, i love coming here with my family and enjoy the vibe inside.

8eOn19D6TriBoGFyQxEJ0g.text: Blueberry pancakes.  That's all you really need to know.  Get them on the side for breakfast and you will be happy for the rest of the day.  The food speaks for itself here.  It's simple and fresh and is served with kindness.  They have a large patio for the few great weather months in AZ.  You will most likely have to wait at least 15 minutes for a table no matter when you arrive,  but it's worth it.

f6O4Ed-xzmBxqtPKVRvQkQ.text: The food and service (when seated) was great!  I definitely recommend it when visiting the area.  It came recommended from the locals there!  The only issue we had was timing.  When they told us it was a 15-20 min wait and we ended up waiting more than twice that.

6F9Edse5-790KKAnvJ64TA.text: As a visitor from San Francisco, I have really high brunch expectations as there is no shortage of delicious brunch joints in SF. Came here around 9:45 on a Friday after our hike at Camelback and did not expect there to be a wait on a working weekday. The wait was about 20 minutes for 2 people, reasonable for a seemingly popular brunch place.  I got the country benedict which was basically biscuits, sausage patty, gravy, and poached eggs with a choice of hash browns or grits. Biscuit and gravy was yummy. My boyfriend got the corned beef hash skillet, which came with a side of either toast or pancakes (he chose pancakes). We also ordered wildberry french toast to share.  Everything was amazing and totally fulfilled our brunch cravings. Wildberry french toast had a drizzle of fruit and vanilla syrup and was stuffed with mascarpone cheese. It wasn't too sweet or too egg-y, just the right amount of sweet fluffiness.  They have their own bottled syrup for the pancakes too! You can also order a coffee from the front barista to enjoy while waiting for a table, and black coffees get free refills once you get seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Close up of the wildberry French toast
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wildberry French toast, corned beef skillet, and country Benedict (clockwise)

hN-TAE1pYCikc6gp4UJxNg.text: Great restaurant for breakfast or brunch. Their pancakes are well worth the calories. The presentation is great, but the taste is better. A must when in Scottsdale.

Ue8JeHcl4mA-4GuuGDwxxQ.text: I went here with my family for Mother's Day. Good food, friendly staff, just a little pricey. I recommend it and would go again.

qt8VewopwUxmkxxTl30eJw.text: Simply fantastic!  Great food, omelet was iron chef perfect! Amazing coffee! Not normal in a place like this! Superb,appropriate service..... constant, but not overbearing coffee refills....  Pleasant setting outside, albeit near busy intersection.  Eat here!

yMcwG1O_NFcI5gUHqUcngQ.text: This place was pretty good! Went here when I was in Phoenix for a wedding and stopped here on our way to the airport. Everything was fresh and as described on the menu. Prices were reasonable and service was good!

-l__KgzK-Yxqlp_qd139jw.text: Butters' service and food are great! The service staff is always friendly and the food is consistently delicious. The menu is defiantly centered around breakfast comfort food. The portion sizes are great for families!

-bD15rog4mim6NTiJ0S7ag.text: I have been twice, and will come again!!  I live probably 30-40 minutes from here, but it is well worth the drive and wait (if there is one)!!  The corn beef hash skillet is amazing, potatoes are great!  Also the pancake is crisp on the outside but so fluffy inside.  The biscuits and gravy taste like grandmas, to die for!  Lastly, the banana cream pancakes are out of this world amazing!!  They are sweet, but the combo is incredibly delicious!!  I can't wait to come back again!!!!   Butters does it right, go here immediatly!!

C-uFWwjfGxBkNT0TZqyCMQ.text: Fastest breakfast in the West...or anyplace else, really.  Was seated in half the quoted wait time.  After perusing the extensive menu and settling on the green chile omelette, food arrived in about 5 minutes.  It was everything a good omelette should be, light and fluffy.  The green chile sauce was bright and decently spicy.  Interesting take on hash browns.  Rather than the typical grated potato, these were very thinly sliced.  With more surface area, the crispiness was enhanced.  Excellent, high-quality, inexpensive breakfast food.  Even the standard issue brewed coffee was really good!  There's nothing really to improve on here!  I would definitely return!

Y7dhV_SFnuf5ZH6MPxNQYw.text: Food: wow this place is good! Have their corn beef skillet. The name sounded gross (got it on a recommendation), however when I got it I was pleasantly surprised. I also looked around at all the other plates and everything looked great and no one looked disappointed. On their drink menu they have fresh squeezed orange juice, that you can actually see them making. I would definitely recommend that.  Service: The service was friendly, fast, and delightful. My food did not take very long at all, I believe the wait was longer.  Location:  Butterfield has its own building in a small shopping plaza located in north Scottsdale. The location was clean and well kept. Although there is generally a wait (usually at least 20 minutes minimum)  it is very much worth it.

MOzw12FthDk_oxFUdnEDrA.text: This was pretty much the best breakfast I've ever had. Everything about my Belgian waffle and bacon was perfect. My date had a pancake combo with an omelette. Again, perfect. The omelette was like an egg calzone; I have no idea how they do it. We shared an OJ, which was the best tasting orange juice either one of us had ever tried.  Service was very adequate and the price was right.  My only bitches are the wait and the amount of crap on the small table. I can see why other reviewers complain about the servers and bussers pulling stuff off the table too quickly, as there are too many bottles of stuff (including a pitcher of water). I don't think they they can do much about the wait.

oc0mc6Nux5bH37wqti40GA.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in Scottsdale!  Every time we have visited (and its been a lot!), the food has been consistently good.    Please note, there is often a wait on the weekends for breakfast!  There is a coffee place in the same lot (Village Coffee), where you can go grab a drink to help pass the time while you enjoy the gorgeous Scottsdale weather.  It could be worse, people!  I almost always get the same thing - Eggs Rojo or Verde but get it Ying/Yang (half/half).  Its my favorite and I can't order anything else!  I always try to snag a bite of something sweet from one of my fellow diners.    The prices are fair - definitely not as expensive as many Scottsdale brunch menus.  Definitely give this a try - or don't to keep the lines shorter!

gu1B1VLRfxEN1eI458URzw.text: This place is my favorite breakfast joint! The or con about this establishment is how popular they are: the wait is always about an hour, but it is definitely worth the wait. I've ordered the berry pancakes and have also had the southwestern rojo omelette...both excellent choices! The servers are super nice and I really appreciate the water that is already waiting for you at your table-no fuss, no muss! If you haven't gone here, GO. NOW!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Worth every single calorie

KDOaFUvsqi8EHWzOEb3DbQ.text: Came here for breakfast this morning, and must say, despite the long wait (even at 1pm!), it was worth it!! Their coffee is fantastic, as is their serving staff. I got the deliciously craving-satiating Wild Berry Bliss Cakes (pancakes with wild berries, stuffed with vanilla marscapone cream and drizzled with vanilla and raspberry sauce). I've heard raves about their eggs rojos, so I'll be ordering those the next time 'round. The person I came with said their corned beef hash was perfection and loved how they added chopped green onion.  The place is a bit small, but I suppose that only adds to the charm. The patio area is cozy and misted.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild Berry Bliss Cakes

bkoqLyRClCE4jVUI8psIVA.text: Fantastic experience today at Butter's!! Danny the manager was very good and listened to me after a great breakfast. Tony was our server and he was attentive, helpful and kind. The meat they use is exceptional.  I was specifically impressed by the 2 people who cleared the tables....less than 30 seconds as there were plenty of people waiting, and their efficiency was evident in how quickly they worked together. Go to Butter's....best treat on a Sunday morning!!

gDbYbP3Js5QKQRc8RFn9kA.text: Tried the New Mexico skillet with hash browns, scrambled eggs, and added cinnamon roll cake pancakes for $1.50. The food came out quickly which surprised me considering the wait to sit down was long. My first thought of the food was that the portions were small but I ate my words once I felt full with only half of my skillet. Everything was truly delicious for the price. I will most likely come back again!

otqtjKPietCt4QOh2Y-v8Q.text: Crowded but worth the hour long wait for breakfast. My favorite was the cheese grits (which they offer as a substitute for breakfast potatoes). The red chile sauce was also a favorite.   The ambiance is loud and crowded but I am willing to overlook for their great food.

WJhVijJrD_iUbYHVudLfAw.text: On the way to the Barrett Jackson auto auction I yelped breakfast.  Right off the 101 I pulled in and the place was packed, good sign! We were seated before expected and as we browsed the menu an employee stacking chairs asked if we needed any assistance with the menu, to my surprise he was able to answer all of my questions and made note that he was the only restaurant that cracked their own eggs and his coffee was from a local coffee shop just down the street. No longer after we ordered, my coffee was topped off twice and the meal was on the table. The breakfast was excellent, service staff was very professional and efficient. All hand selected by the man stacking chairs.   On the bucket list for my next trip to Scottsdale AZ

pdLBUAY-waiyGhFk295Udw.text: I've never been much of a breakfast guy because too many carbs in the morning makes me sleep all day.  But let me tell you, THIS is a place to visit.  I came here with my compadres Roland (who also reviewed this place), Jenna and Shaun.  Place is in a very nice shopping center, not too far down the road from Jimmy John's (drool).  Let me start with the food.  Something like Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast.  My mom would kill me if I told her it's better than her Creme Brulee French Toast or her Grand Marnier French Toast, so I just won't say anything.  But it is AMAHHHZING.  I ordered a side of sausage and a side of bacon, and I shouldn't have ordered either.  They were also amahhhzing, but the entree was enough to fill me up.  Needless to say, I took a huge nap afterwards.  Every time I see Jenna and Roland check-in without me on Yelp, they get angry texts from me.  This Wednesday I'm having brunch at Butterfield's on Scottsdale and Shea...I'm told it's same ownership?  We shall see if it compares to the deliciousness that was Butters.

pa5YMYh1FIf-yqYAus8qeg.text: I just had to write this review immediately after visiting.  I have to say I have never had a perfect dining experience before in my LIFE.... And thanks to the staff here it was flawless.  Before my drive back from the day after the Super Bowl where my Seahawks lost I was feeling down.  Looking to Yelp to find some comfort food before heading back to Los Angeles I find this place that was highly reviewed.  We walked in and immediately was greeted with a smile by the hostess and was whisked away to our table.  Within moments our waitress "Monica" greeted us with a smile and took our drink order.    When our food was delivered within 10 minutes and (I had the eggs Benedict) I found the poached egg to be PERFECTLY cooked.  The flavor clean and what was expected from a perfect Eggs Benedict.    After finishing the helpers pre-bussed while Monica kept on coming back to make sure we were taken care of.  We were in and out in less than 30 minutes (although we could've stayed longer we wanted to leave AZ as fast as we can to get back).  Nevertheless I will be back in 2 weeks for Breakfast.  Every entrepreneur should look at the way this place is run as a case study of how to run a restaurant.

QKiouFrwQVUNNjEhu-y1Nw.text: Always fantastic! Everything about this place makes it a great breakfast spot. Nice wide selection of breakfast foods.  Yes, as most reviews say, it gets ridiculously packed. We got there around 8:20 AM on a Sunday and still had to wait 10 minutes. I highly recommend getting there early if you don't want to wait. Otherwise, everything here is awesome!

ugF2Bdd-MYBXk3mSFaGXSQ.text: Came here on Sunday for brunch with my boyfriend for the first time and I can't wait to visit this place again food was delicious especially their pancakes

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

S1Fd4AmimnfBPF9jfpUIWg.text: The breakfast was excellent.  I had the a traditional egg and bacon breakfast but there were so many other choices. I definitely recommend this place if you've never been. Fast service. Go early.

N_4agRW-euKaZTj6WhjpHw.text: No other way to put it, delicious! I've been 3 times in the past few months. Everything is terrific

ALoJFiZ9kLAXnhDVBIF_zA.text: A friend visiting needed to be taken to a special place for Brunch. Yelp suggested Butters and was not wrong. It is a very good place to enjoy a long, lazy brunch facing the fountains (if you are lucky). However, long is the key word here. The wait is quite long on weekends and they don't take reservations beforehand. Pity the mall it is located in doesn't have much to kill time in (everything else is also an eating joint!) but the fountain made for some good backdrop for taking selfies.. :)  On the food, we ordered the Garden skillet, Egss Rojo/Verde and the buttermilk pancakes. The pancakes win hands down, the best I have had. The other two are decent but not the best I have had. Do go for a long lazy brunch and have sufficient time to go take a nap afterwards.

bKYfIsV3XLvi4DJ2u0p2Qw.text: Always worth the wait  best pancakes of my life, a lot of food for a great price, food comes out quick and I have never had a bad experience!!

Gl9XUg1xlwa4t6uq6hb3DA.text: This place is DELICIOUS!  I had their Whole Hog Skillet with extra ham, and their Wild Berry Cakes. Incredible.  So good.    Service is great ... the patio is great ... it's all great.  The only thing in my opinion that keeps it from being 5 stars is that you can't do a "call-ahead" or make reservations.  Lines can get very very long, which can be annoying.  All in all though, it's worth the wait.  ENJOY!

z_q-0AzqeVyPUA4dqbFkQg.text: Always a great breakfast. It's a staple when we go to Scottsdale. Excellent food even if the line is huge every morning.

cGD6CZnAmuV4-jkmwRpGfA.text: Best breakfast ever!!! The veg omelette with the strawberry pancakes was wonderful along with fresh squeezed orange juice. Had the wild berry french toast for brunch the next day. Wish we had one of these near Akron, Ohio!!!! We have nothing that compares.

EfmnnVc0PK8QLiVLz_FQ_g.text: Spent a week in Scottsdale with the fellas for NCAA tournament and Cubs spring training games. Had breakfast at a different place each morning. Butters was absolutely the best breakfast I had there. One of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. Everything was fresh and hot. Each guy had something different and also praised the food. Quick service and reasonably priced. It's worth the wait in line. Highly recommended

NrIDmZzCf0vwnU5kh6CUvw.text: Don't often review, but after dining here felt compelled to write! Pancakes are excellent! They are cooked perfectly, and light enough that they do not leave you with the felling of having swallowed a man hole cover. Bacon is cooked to perfection, flavorful, and not the least bit greasy. The coffee is delicious, as is the freshly squeezed orange juice. Service is attentive and unobtrusive. A must-try for breakfast!

QinpQPDnIWlYz3KZKh0uNw.text: We decided to try something new for breakfast today and it was great! We went on a Saturday at about 11 am and had to wait about 20 minutes because the restaurant was so busy. When we got seated everything was very efficient. We got coffee and drinks quickly and a pitcher of ice water was on the table when we sat down.  My wife and I ordered a scrambler and a sweet crepe and split them both. There was tons of food! We will be skipping lunch because we are so full. The food came out hot and extra quick (about 5 minutes). There was no slowdown of service because they were busy.  Great place and we will definitely be going again.

12V2g1cAG9eHuP4lyjt-Pw.text: Basically a local IHOP. Had the California scramble with chocolate chip pancakes and Irish eggs benedict.  Pancakes were light and fluffy. Hash browns were more like scalloped potatoes and not very good. Took 40 minutes to get in the door for a table of two but food came out like 5 minutes after ordering. Plates were huge.

F8imZregVRSZtl7Rmp8Y4Q.text: We ate here on our way to The Open on the 4th and the food was delicious!!  We sat outside where the weather was gorgeous.  The pancakes are to die for-so soft and delicious!  Their coffee was also great, but getting cream or other things was a bit difficult at times.  The waitress kept just walking by... All in all, I would eat here again. Just hope the service is a bit better best time.  So I only gave 4 stars.

hARgRQiVaE-E5v7M2ajh3A.text: Great food at great prices.! We were very pleased- Regina remembered everything! My kids split the two eggs, sausage & chocolate chip pancakes! Superb! I had sweet delicious cinnamon apple crepes and hubby had hog scramble. Everyone enjoyed everything!

oGgoP9lvRhfmuotgGjKTAQ.text: So yum! There were 5 of us for breakfast and all of us loved what we ordered. Not a single negative about of any of it.

h_kEOhHV_eXbw8qaedaPzQ.text: Went to Butters with my boyfriend this past weekend after a morning hike and honestly we were both quite disappointed with our meals. After reading all the fantastic Yelp reviews I expected a much better breakfast than I received.   Not saying what I ate wasn't good but it certainly wasn't anything extraordinary. I ordered the egg breakfast with the Oreo smores pancakes and my boyfriend had the same but with chocolate chip pancakes.  We both didn't like the hash browns it reminded us of baked potatoes and we're not impressed with out pancakes. One thing that was nice was the service, Yelp does not lie about quick service and nice waiters.  Overall the place is okay but considering how far away it is from where I live I won't be coming back.

UTxiTrMx37csWplM5boDeQ.text: Made the mistake of eating breakfast out on a Saturday. Morning....quite a long wait in the heat. Quite a small table for 2, crammed in. OJ was fresh squeezed as promised, was 20 more minutes before our pancakes and eggs arrived, nothing out of the ordinary, coffees ok. Have had better elsewhere.

GzCei5Bwrn4Q7X7jezgmlQ.text: Typical breakfast spot. I'm happy we came here but I wasn't completely blown away. We got the New Mexico skillet and it was delicious. We also got the mixed berry pancakes. You have to get the pancakes!!! I don't even care for pancakes but after reading reviews I knew we had to get them and was so happy we did! It was a little too sweet with the cream in the middle so we just ate around it. But plenty of berries no need for syrup and oh so moist and fluffy. I would for sure come back for more pancakes! We luckily didn't have to wait since we came on a Thursday morning around 10am. If the wait is longer than 40min, I would probably pass. But check this place out. And get the pancakes!!!

xt6kPkMhE6QWjDIdszsK6A.text: This place is AMAZING! We're not from around here so we even ordered our pancakes again right after because we loved them so much! Can not rave enough about how good these pancakes are I only wish we had this place in the Bay Area!

dI7VI8WH78D1dbSKeRkQQQ.text: This place is the best bkfast spot in AZ! It's become the only place we will go. Service is always impressive & food is amazing. Oreo pancakes, cinnamon roll pancakes & country Benedict are my go-to's.

30iEn2wYYZ-1pB9y8wuSIA.text: Awesome breakfast with large portions. Had Omelette and Pancakes. Very hot very fresh. Great flavor to everything. Service was awesome. Found totally by accident. Will return on next visit.

geVT1m1ljXmWTySaKv0gPg.text: I really liked this place! I will comeback for sure,  it was a 35 min wait to get a table in a Saturday morning but totally worth it!! Those pancakes mmmmmm

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Omelet with chorizo and green sauce and a side of banana and regular pancakes

S9dvQD-0uJ5-2IBtluWZjg.text: Fantastic food!  Our server Regina was super!  She was friendly, attentive, and professional. The pancakes were light and the size of a frisbee.  The omlette's were the size of a loaf of bread.  The orange juice was so fresh it's momma didn't miss it yet.  Yeah, we kinda liked it here.  Will be back

v1dGeuFHBK8iRq2rZBPINQ.text: Anyone who knows me can tell you I have the biggest sweet tooth of anyone they have met.  So, when you combine pancakes with chocolate, marshmallow sauce, whip cream, and stuff it with Oreos-you have me beaming with delight!  But wait, not only does Butter's have the most delicious pancakes I have ever had (I ordered the Oreo stuffed s'more pancakes), they also have ginormous omelettes, Nutella stuffed crepes with bananas, waffles with bacon, and fresh squeezed oj.  Yes, I tried them all in one sitting. Yes, they were all as amazing as they sound. Yes, I am in a food coma and happy as can be.  Oh, and the service?  Superb! Everyone had smiles on their faces, was warm and friendly, and highly attentive.    What about the atmosphere? As we speak, I am writing this review on the outdoor patio, overlooking beautiful Scottsdale and a gorgeous fountain, with misters keeping me cool.    5 stars hands down!

fd0eRvgRt_px1T-pf8tWaA.text: Haven't been here for a couple years but it is as good as it was. Good portions of great food!  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own omelet.

mEExfoW6wsoc_vcfIEltaA.text: Visiting from Las Vegas and found this gem on yelp!  Get there early or go enjoy a manicure next door while you wait, we waited 25 min but well worth the wait. Ordered the corned beef hash skillet with pancakes and the California omelet. Per the waitresses recommendations, she was right. They are very busy and tight seating unless your in a booth, but I enjoy these atmospheres. I also ordered the americano, it wasn't my favorite. The service was amazing and great food!

Zq37n9ARswkOWCpnulAUbw.text: Great food and service! On weekends, make sure to get there early as the place gets really busy. We got there around 10am on a Sunday and had to wait 30 minutes before being seated.

RRD3IN0EUeOxL6qMRy8J0A.text: We were able to get a seat quickly as it is a Friday at 11a. Nice patio with large fountain close. It is close to the road so you can hear traffic. The food was great. We chose the California Omlette and for $1.50 up charge we added premium pancakes which we chose wild berry. Eggs were delicious and the pancakes were very tastie. We were able to choose GF option with the pancakes. Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Omlette with Wild Berry Pancakes

QfLVzHm0cR44cCyWQtw8vg.text: Very good consistent breakfast restaurant. We eat here all the time.  We have not had a bad experience.  The coffee is great and the atmosphere is great for a wonderful cup of coffee and a good fresh consistent breakfast no matter what you choose.  I usually have the sausage egg breakfast.  Yummy,  I had the corn beef hash and eggs the other day and it's not the canned corn beef.  It was very good and light.  I was surprised.  Great place to eat, good service, easy parking and you can get a spot in line with the help app.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dGCO3mzDt8-1fgAUFwj3iQ.text: Great Breakfast. Quality food and beverages. Great service - given the number of customers that line up on the weekend. Anticipate an average wait time of 30 mins. Food is worth the wait. Once on the wait list, you will get queue tracking (on Yelp) that will help monitor your number on the list and time left - great convenience.  Don't miss the pancakes and OJ.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh OJ.

qakwccMfoQZBpeSRh6bvtQ.text: Our group of 8 golfers are visiting from the northwest. We got the best service and greatest breakfast of our whole trip.  We are planning to go again before we leave.

Nljt_-gcYvBEatmGcC36GA.text: This is hands down our favorite place for breakfast in Scottsdale.  The coffee is amazing.  The menu is ample and has a larger than average selection of breakfast item.  Everything from pancakes, omlettes and eggs to French toast. The potions here are as large as the selection.  A typical omelette comes with your choice of three added ingredients, hash browns (better if they are well done/crispy) and your choice of pancakes or toast.  For a minimal up charge of $1.50 you can upgrade to a signature pancake like cinnabun or pecan.  All options are delicious and a great add on especially if you're sharing. Butters has amazing orange juice and coffee.  They are menu highlights and not to be missed.  Although I think the speed has improved and the foid is the same great quality in their new location, I have to say I miss the charm of the old location. A special shout out to our server Alex, who on our second trip in recognized us.  She was a delight and took very good care of us plenty of coffee and good menu selections.

GaHjrYt02sIpia4DK9Z-gg.text: Great breakfast and quick service.  Enjoy the meal and would strongly recommend their skillets.  So GOOD!!!

PW1QBhl4wySosVYeokFdpA.text: There are many breakfast restaurants around that I feel are better than Butters. It was my first time in the new location and aesthetically, it is pleasing to the eye, but the food is the same. Pretty bland.  It is clear the waitress who served my friend and I had one mission : to get my friend and I out the door as fast as possible. She never came by to offer my friend and I more coffee, but other waitresses did and when I asked her to refill my cup, she said she'd fill it to go. Thanks for pushing us out the door.  I'd prefer eating elsewhere. Noci, Snooze, First Watch - all those places kindly allow eaters to chat and not feel rushed out the door.

azkwcY9EZMdfywSnR3OR2A.text: Best breakfast we have had hands down!! We ordered a skillet, a turkey-bacon sandwich, crepes, and the buttermilk pancakes. Not only was the food outstanding, but the service was impeccable! We were seated with Monica and we will only ask for her section from here on out!! Our new favorite breakfast joint...they will not disappoint! Also, you have to try their fresh-squeezed OJ!! (:

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cmF5Go-oPWFWG7ATkLTS2A.text: Hands down my favorite breakfast spot.  Whether I'm eating one of their famous skillets (Whole Hog is the best), omelettes or Benedicts,  I've never been disappointed.  The service is friendly and quick, but never rushed, coffee is always at hand and the orange juice is the best I have ever tasted anywhere.  Great place for breakfast, brunch or lunch.  And, really, I'm not kidding about the orange juice!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Country Benny and the best orange juice I&#39;ve ever tasted.

L0Cb1RCFLrj3wz8dDUz7mQ.text: This was my second time eating at Butter's and I can't wait until I go again. All of the food is delicious. The coffee is smooth and never ending. The staff is always polite and professional. The pancakes are so good... You need them in your life.

17vOGYFXYMPvy5eKVCXpMg.text: Yummy! Best grits in town and their gluten-free pancakes are delicious. Fast and friendly service makes Butters a no brainer.

baLHDaQ9xdOMsnvz64D54w.text: Amazing! Every-time we're in Scottsdale, we have to have breakfast here. The most fluffy eggs ever!

OmgqIoZxPsE7vCom--chHg.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot! I go out of my way to have food here. The smoked salmon scramble....

k7QuZcjnk67pkYYxpUHhhg.text: It was $11 for two pieces of french toast that came with no sides. Not even any fruit. While the french toast was very good, it was not worth the price tag. It was also a twenty minute wait and it was a very loud place to eat. It seemed like my wife and I nearly had to yell to hear each other. Overall, we left the breakfast feeling underserved for paying what we paid in total. We both agreed that we don't think we will be back anytime soon. There are definitely other diners that will give you a lot more for less $$.

0nlfqSk0eoNLvjwRyywGLQ.text: The only place I eat pancakes!   Lucky I visit Scottsdale from Prescott often! Serve and hash browns are great too

hZlEn8teR2dmc1t6az22sQ.text: I really enjoy the food but not the wait to the table. Hand the Thai chicken salad and their famous pancakes. Did enjoy them.

kXVkwPZhSQoOWcMLPplD0Q.text: Good breakfast spot.  Delicious eggs Verde with hash browns covered in cheese and peppers.  Fast, and friendly service from some very beautiful waitresses are the icing on the cake!  Would definitely go back to try some of the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs Verde with hash browns covered with cheese and peppers.

QW_tYT3nSd4TPcaJVhGbFg.text: They say that a lot of butter will kill you, but come to Butters and at least you can spend it in food heaven. With a lot of Thanksgiving cooking to do today, we figured we'd spare ourselves the hassle of breakfast dishes so we came here and have NO REGRETS... literally, in life. Hahaha. Seriously though, their freshly squeezed OJ was fantastic, not too sweet or sour, just perfect. I have the Banana Creme French toast, which was literally the most delicious french toast I have ever had. When the waitress asked me if I was done so she could take my plate, I told her she'd better before I starting licking the plate. She laughed, thinking I wasn't serious. My husband had the Wildberry Bliss Pancakes, which my husband is NOT a pancake person but he finished his food faster than I did. Luckily, I got a bite of his and for once, our food tied on whose was better. When asking him how it was, he has no words... then finally replied, "Two thumbs waaaaaaay up. Great combination of berries, mascarpone sauce." Overall- great experience. Great service. Nicely priced! Will definitely return soon.

ZU_qB9kO9eZGvs8TKKZyHQ.text: This is my favorite breakfast place!!! It's the only place I eat at when i'm in town from chicago. I will say their selection and service is absolutely great. The coffee is not my favorite but it's not bad either.  Pretty pricey for breakfast but i think that's an overall scottsdale thing. Usually ALWAYS packed but they always found me a table for one with ease.

lBbeSToITWbEMvyWHPoXKQ.text: We decided to stop by this today for an impromptu early lunch. My sons dentist appointment is near here so what better way to end a dentist appointment then to stuff your face?   We were enthusiastically greeted the minute we walked in and seated. Our server was asking us for our drinking within seconds of sitting down which was great. After we ordered, our food came really fast and was delicious! My French toast looked so good, even the people sitting next to us asked me what I ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Creme French Toast
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whole Hog Skillet

BCo1KU0Ak8OhIh2FwuxbBw.text: I was in Butters many years ago when I visited Scottsdale.  I would definitely drive out of my way to come here any time.  The restaurant is huge.  Seriously, monster seating for breakfast.  The menu is quite comprehensive and strongly focused on doing breakfast right, and to be inclusive of many many options.  Today, I am getting the sausage and eggs with bacon and pancakes.  This also came with fruit on the side.  I don't eat a lot of carbs, but I eat the pancakes when I come here.  The place is always very clean, the staff is knowledgeable, efficient and friendly.   Butters caters to people with special diets, I am having gluten free pancakes here today.  The last time I was here, I had the gluten free cheese grits.  The food speaks for itself and the quality is over and beyond.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for an over the top breakfast experience.  I will likely eat here every day that I am here.

qTnPQRfBktIaY_8sTKMERw.text: This place is tight.  I sat outside, even though it was hot as balls, the misters felt good on my neck.  Okay anyways... The chorizo is really good here.  The iced coffee is like, meh, and tastes more like fancy chocolate milk.  I can't sub my pancakes for a waffle so I was like boo. However, food is great and comes out really fast. Worth the wait. Took my left overs home and ate them after a fat afternoon nap.  I'll be back son.

IO6i0qYuflPwzauOBjqa0w.text: Butters is a top tier brunch spot in all of Arizona. The diner feel is a classic and Butters pulls it off with a modern look. Service is always friendly and quick every time I go. They have a large selection of items and everything is fresh and tasty.   I usually get the California scramble, which comes with meat and avocado inside. You can substitute the side cheaply for their specialty pancakes. I particularly like the Oreo pancakes, and the cinnamon pancakes are good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My friend hitting on another member of our church choir.
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Giving my friend Bryce pancakes.
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oreo pancake - Yum!

1CaqNDfqMXzXfTNf7Q1IUw.text: This place is always crowded and with good reason. The food here is good. I am not going to say it is the best breakfast I have ever had in the Valley, but it was quite tasty. Pancakes are light and fluffy and the savory dishes were flavored appropriately. I did appreciate the coffee bar for our 45 minute wait. Wait staff was friendly and efficient.

yzzf3_oThAUQl0fVgUNH9g.text: 1500++ reviews in this little desert? You can bet Butters Pancakes & Cafe caught my eye. So when the first weekend of the month rolled around and it was time to broach the topic of our monthly brunch meetup, I casually laid Butters on the table as an option for brunch - it worked. And off to Butters we went.  Looking up directions on my phone, I took a double take when I saw the Sunday wait times at 10AM - you're looking at a 45 minute wait. And as much as I love my best friend, I really would rather not stand around and wait for a table (much rather sit around with food, honestly. With a mimosa or bloody mary). Thankfully, and boy am I thankful, you can put your name in via Yelp which basically is like giving your hostess a heads-up that you're on your way and you've got yourself a place in line!  Getting to Butters, it was packed - I saw someone walk away after hearing about the 45 minute wait and I was secretly glad that I chanced upon the check-in function via Yelp. All-in-all, we waited for 15 minutes after letting the hostess know we've arrived before we were seated.  Fast forward to the food - I went with my waitress' favorite, the Mexicana omelette which is wonderful if you're a chorizo fan. It's packed with avocados and chorizo, wrapped in an omelette and did I mention, your choice of melted cheese? I went with pepper jack. You also get a choice of grits or hash browns (hash browns, please) and pancakes or toast (pancakes, duh). You'll also have the option to upgrade to a specialty cake for $1.50 which means you get to choose one of the fancy pancakes in place of the buttermilk pancakes they would otherwise serve you on the side. That option right there, won me over. A little odd pet peeve I have about brunch places is that they either serve you a plate full of sweets (so think Belgian waffles or 3 giant pancakes) without any sort of savory goodness (like eggs or bacon). Or they serve you up a hearty breakfast (think corned beef hash or country fried steak) with a measly side option of sweets (maybe jam on toast). I'm greedy - I want both. And Butters had just that - a hearty omelette, with hash browns, the perfect medium to eat hot sauce, and decadent pancakes, where I went with a stack of two apple cinnamon pecan caramel pancakes. I could've done with even more caramelized apples and pecans but I tend to overdo things - the amount of apples and pecans topping my pancake stack was perfect. They even had pecan pieces mixed into the pancake itself, which added a nice little nuanced texture to my pancake.  In a nutshell, a little far but totally worth the drive. Definitely check-in beforehand, and always upgrade to a specialty cake. Five out of five and of course, a keeper!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexicana omelette - living the chorizo life
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Upgraded my side of pancakes to apple cinnamon pecan - I have no regrets

u0gbMdYBaQNTPiby0mocvQ.text: Clean restaurant, friendly service, and delicious food! Pro tip: sub your toast for pancakes and pay the up charge for a specialty cake of your choice - our waitress recommended the Berry Bliss and I see why. It was SO good! By husband was jealous - he ordered the banana which was also good, but just creamy and sweet if that's what you're into. The berry cakes had berries cooked into them, topped with fresh berries and layered with a creamy goodness that tasted like cheesecake. We both got skillets  so good. He got the meat one and loved it, I got the Mexican one + jalapenos... worth every calorie. Also, fluffiest eggs ever.

dhRV_nwk43DNgbbB1rJpVw.text: Love this place, was out on wait list for first time since I didn't get there till after 9am. But it moved pretty good and definitely worth the wait. Everyone in this place is so nice, you couldn't possibly be in a bad mood after entering this place. Had the skillet this time and it came out fast and fresh. It came along with a couple of pancakes that where to OMG die for!!!! Also the coffee in this place is the best, freshly brewed

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ro3OOnTeZgPEmyxvYaIG2w.text: I have never left a breakfast spot so stuffed and blissed out! Butters is officially my new favorite breakfast restaurant. Full stop.   I ordered the Santa Fe scrambler, which comes with chorizo, cheese, onions and jalapenos. It was honestly one of the best breakfast dishes I have ever tried! All of their scrambler meals come with breakfast potatoes plus toast or pancakes. Obviously, I got the pancakes and I upgraded to their specialty Berry Bliss pancakes. Somuchbliss! Will 100% return.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Santa Fe scrambler
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side of berry bliss pancakes

RuW2E1REHyNllyel9znzSw.text: Husband and I came here a few times during our recent Scottsdale vacay. Excellent omelettes and pancakes. Eggs Benedict will not disappoint. The Eggs Rojo was flavor filled and delicious.  The coffee is also delicious, with the heavy cream giving it something a little extra. We really loved this place!

qSiJMT-f2GwSOQ0lVFCjeQ.text: Absolutely best "cuisine" breakfast in town! Expect perfectly executed dishes every time. Eggs fluffier than if you made them in heaven. The most flavorful OJ, the most unique pancakes... this place is the best & always has a wait for a reason.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten free pancakes- can tell it&#39;s GF because of the poker :)
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New Mexico skillet

U6i7p_uaO5Fz33AJVn92SA.text: Delicious food! Went on a Sunday morning around 11am so yes there was a wait but I did the Yelp check in and it was very useful in adding my name to the list and both texting and calling me when my table was ready. Parking actually was pretty convenient for us but I can see how it may be a competition for spots in the lot.   I ordered scrambled eggs, grits and a banana crunch pancake. The food was so good. Eggs were scrambled to perfection and the pancake was a buttermilk fluffy sugar coma.   We sat outside and the chillers were on making it actually slightly cold but I'll take that over burning up in the hot AZ weather.  The waitress was very attentive and nice, the food cake out pretty quick and it's decently priced.  I really enjoyed brunch here and would definitely come back and try more varieties of pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

y5YApImsZkuAjw7Kg2LFTg.text: Another good breakfast at Butters. Had the New Mexico Omelette with choriso and jalapeno. Not too spicy. They were very accomodating on substitutions so got the sliced tomato and fruit cup. Service was great. Coffee cup was always full. Place was packed for a Monday at 10 a.m. Always a good sign.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New Mexico Omelette
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Scramble

fDrareSlma787O7OtKB31Q.text: We LOVE this place! We went here for breakfast three days in a row during our 6 day trip.  Everything we had are PERFECT! And everyone there are super friendly! The place is Modena an super CLEAN!   We had egg Benedict in two different styles; banana special French toast; berry bliss pancake which upgraded for only 1.5 bucks with egg combo ( I'm not a pancake person, but this one is amazing.) the Mexicana omelette is a must try, very Mexican and delicious! The latte and caramel macchiato are great (way better than Starbucks :P) !!  We will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jAT5bHEp3ngICZML3ML0PA.text: Awesome! The food was great & the service was even better. We were able to sub stuff, upgrade etc without a problem. I got the omelet & the power pancakes. My friend got one of the scrambles & the strawberry chocolate chip pancakes. Everything was amazing! It was fresh and just great. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Power Pancakes
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scramble with potatoes and side of chocolate chip strawberry pancakes
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Omelette with side of cheese grits

ByIVyZB_pGduhcukWkSjkg.text: Always delicious and very busy! Get there early!

R-j6TVBXn3bOfobpIs0ezQ.text: The omelets and pancakes here are to die for.  Omelet is fluffy and savory, pancakes are just right.     Definitely try the orange juice too!!! Service is friendly always!

J9qxeiD_YaTJ4I_A5jG9aw.text: Delicious.  Short on paleo/keto options and non-caffeinated drinks that aren't soda, but otherwise tasty and good service.  Would try again.

Q53bykY93bg9QD6s6qqeog.text: I DON'T EVEN KNOW WHERE TO BEGIN...   My husband and I are visiting all the way from Charlotte NC... my friend wanted to take us out for breakfast and this was the place she recommended...   I WAS BLOWN AWAY! I couldn't believe the reviews from this place so I was so excited to try it out. Let me tell you... it did NOT disappoint.   My friend ordered the Cinnamon roll cakes, my husband ordered the biscuits and gravy with eggs, and I built my own omelet and had grits with cheese and pancakes! So much food but that's what came with my order!!! In Charlotte it's VERY hard to find GOOD grits... if you LOVE grits... look NO further!!! Everything... I mean everything we ordered was FANTASTIC! I was extremely impressed. Our server was very friendly.   I have already been back since my last visit a few days ago... I am a HUGE fan! Whatever the kitchen is doing... they are doing things right!!! This place is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iOhP1xVMUhDZhq6gZGusoQ.text: The food is excellent!!!! The pancakes are perfect. Definitely order the fresh squeezed OJ- it will make your day. Eggs, bacon, grits and oatmeal are all cook well.  Just make sure to ask for REAL MAPLE SYRUP because what is at the table is flavored sugar. Also the fake syrup they sell is expensive.

LhCIZx6iars7tfmigC7Ygw.text: This place is incredible.  It's worth the wait people.  I chose the berry pancake and egg scramble; outdoor seating.  Life is good.

bYGToAnUmMLyeoZfjdnNWg.text: This restaurant is horrible, the management rude.  We tried to have a breakfast meeting here and were having difficulty with our seating.  When we asked to be moved to a booth that would accommodate our group, the manager came up to us and told us that if we wanted to have a meeting, that there was a library not far away that would be more appropriate.  When questioned about his suggestion and asked if he cared about our business, he looked at us and said, "Honestly, I don't" amidst his suggestion to take our meeting elsewhere due to their limited seating.
