I ordered an egg white omelette which was a lot of food and was very good. It came with two small pancakes on the side and they were also worth it.  Quick service and good breakfast food. Can't go wrong.

42c7pLVErdWf8T7ux2Isew.text: Fantastic food and service. The fresh squeezed OJ was delicious. I enjoyed the Popeye scramble and my husband had the New Mexico skillet. Recommend both.

bGmPnVNPHksAZmBFYpaqiQ.text: Best breakfast ever. Orange juice is amazing. This place is always busy no matter what day of the week, or what time it is. They even have more fruit than cantaloupe and honeydew for my infant son to eat & I think that's awesome!! I haven't had the lunch here yet because I'm so stuck on the breakfast haha!

OwJzYdGDttYHjAxt5cBGiQ.text: My new favorite breakfast spot. The portions are large and yummy. They have a nice patio but be warned the place is always super busy so plan to wait for a table. The wait will be worth it once you taste the pancakes.

HIKJvdcp-KORVllysHE-4w.text: The food was wonderful and the service was excellent.  Cassie, our waitress was Awesome.  We had the pleasure of dining there twice for breakfast and Cassie was our waitress on both days.  Our group ranged from 5 to 7 people over the course of our two visits.  Cassie was such a pleasure to accommodate our large group plus our to go orders for family at home.  We recommend the eggs, grits, coffee, hash browns, and pancakes.  The grits and eggs are truly delicious.  Our breakfast for our vacations to Scottsdale will always include a stop at Butters.  Hopefully, with Cassie as our waitress!

_oHxqAzs-sI5soCde7pY5w.text: Absolutely stellar, high-quality food with outstanding service. From the moment you step foot inside the restaurant you are greeted by a genuine, kind host. They seat promptly, with water already awaiting you at your table. I asked for pancakes, scrambled eggs with sausage, hash browns, and a cappuccino frost.   Where to start?! The cappuccino frost is a delicious blended coffee drink. Butters has a real espresso machine, and the man preparing the coffee prepared it with delight. I mean, I could taste the joy in this coffee. SO GOOD.   The eggs were cooked to perfection; super flavorful and extraordinarily fluffy. The sausage was delicious, as were their pancakes. The hash browns aren't the traditional hash browns one is accustomed to; they're more like scalloped potatoes. BUT they are delicious nonetheless.  The only thing that makes the food even more enjoyable is the wonderful attitude all the employees have. The environment and ambiance is very lovely. Easily one of my favorite breakfast joints!

4Rd72mt_tf_pX-gChGCZ7Q.text: Holy cow....far exceeded my expectations. The food was DELICIOUS and our server was PHENOMENAL. We had Benedict, skillet, omelet, and pancakes and everyone loved their food. Dre, our server, was attentive, sweet, and on top of all (of our many) request. She was especially sweet to our two year old making sure she had everything she needed, even though she was busy. By far the best were their potatoes. Highly recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Just enjoying some gluten free Mickey Mouse cakes!

eYfL8sdv4OqgOgw0nUDYqg.text: Butters is by far the best breakfast joint in the state. Period! You simply won't find better pancakes elsewhere and can always expect great service! At this location, you can enjoy your breakfast on their lovely patio... This is one of my favorite patios in town! Whether it be breakfast, brunch or lunch, this place has great options for everyone. Very reasonable prices, fresh food, and FAST service. When I went last week we got our food within 10-15 minutes - now that's service. I will always recommend Butters to any local or those visiting the area!

AepIMDkNZPVG2BJqj0SoLg.text: Food was as expected, didn't blow my mind but was very good. The pancakes were beautifully fluffy. My only complaint was the restaurant wasn't very busy as I went in early before the church rush came. I sat with my bible and was doing some studying throughout my meal, and was rushed the entire time. I get that turning tables effectively is a way for the waitress to make more money but I didn't even have time to breathe. I didn't feel I was being inconsiderate with my studying considering it was dead and way early in the morning. I was in and out in less than 35 minutes and felt unwanted. Great coffee and food but the waitresses don't have a great way to hide their obvious agendas.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8l62pNdyCCdVvBMJ1Vmasw.text: Ok the basic pancake was good.   Would not say the best, but good.   Service was good, coffee was good.   But i ordered pecan pancakes.  I expected pecans to be in the batter, not chopped on top of the pancake.   I am glad i did not order the blueberry pancakes as the last one i had was in upstate new york.  the bottom of each pancake was all blueberries with blueberries cooked into the pancake.  At $8.75 i expected a bit larger then 4 6inch pancakes.   And finally.  How can you be upper end and not serve real maple syrup.  Ok charge me an extra buck, I am already up to $12 for a pancake breakfast and coffee.  Don't mind paying for it, but i do expect to leave thinking i can't wait to go back.    Easily the most overpriced pancake breakfast i have ever had.  I spoke with my wife who had managed kitchens and yes Pecans should go in the batter.   I was able to also see the menue after writing this .. The description was 'stuffed'  .. so what i got was not what i should have gotten.  I was served 4 buttermilk pancakes (same size as the one my son got as a substitute for toast).   His were chocolate chip and the pancakes were not stuffed.  He immediately rubbed it in and said .. Dad for 2 bucks more you could have gotten an Eggs skillit and 2 pancakes.  My guess is that they screwed up and the waitress grabbed buttermilk pancakes throwing the topping on them.   2nd screw up i assume was that i got pancakes that would have been provided as a sub for toast.

3MzMH5JKnI95hmT_bH01Xg.text: Love this place! Always make a stop when in town... never disappoints. Wish I could convince you to open a location in Charlotte :)

rTxhRkAEwdS-cO2RifHwYw.text: My daughter came home for the weekend and we all wanted to go out for brunch. So what do you do? Of course, check out your Yelp bookmarks. I've had Butters bookmarked for awhile. So we decided to try.   We got there and had to wait for a good 15 minutes. Their indoor waiting area is really small but they do have an outdoor waiting area too. They give you one of those remote buzzers so that cool. Anyways, we got seated and got a booth by the window. It's a pretty big dining area that looks fairly modern for a breakfast joint. Nice and clean.   Our server greeted us right away and took our drink orders. Surprisingly, our drinks came fairly quickly.   I ordered the Whole Hog Skillet and an upgrade to one of their signature cakes. Got the Wildberry Bliss cakes. The Skillet came with hash brown potatoes, bacon, ham, & sausage with two scrambled eggs and jack & cheddar cheese. Oh my goodness, loved it. The hash browns were great. Loved how the potatoes are sliced thin and browned just enough to give it that crispness. It was really good. Enjoyed it a lot. I'm so glad I upgraded to the signature cakes. The Wildberry Bliss was so good. They give you two cakes and it has fresh berries with vanilla cream. Wasn't too sweet but really good. Didn't even need syrup. The fresh berries just topped it off. Really good  My daughter got the Eggs Verde that had corn tortillas on the bottom with black beans, eggs, jack cheese with green chile sauce smothering it. Came with their hash browns too. I snuck a bite and it was so good. My daughter loved it too. The green chile sauce had enough kick to it. This whole dish just somehow came together. Really good dish.  Then my wife ordered the eggs with chicken sausage and hash browns. She loved it. Said the eggs were so fluffy and she loved the chicken sausage. She was raving about her breakfast. She even said that this was probably one of the best breakfast she's had. That's pretty big compliment from her.   Anyways, service was excellent. Quick and efficient. Our server check on us and didn't have to fill our water cups cause they have a water jar so you can fill yourself. Really like that. She was busy but always kept track of us.   So we had a great breakfast here. Great food, great service. Nice atmosphere. Everyone at the other tables seem to enjoy themselves.  Do yourself a favor and try this place. I will be back and I have no problem ordering the same thing or something else. It's all good. Enjoy

8N853Hcf5wxMNDs_1MjTXQ.text: Best pancakes and orange juice around! Everything always taste good. Their crepes are amazing! Always a bit of a wait but so worth it

lnZov0Y9RHp3yWEbiGh76A.text: Okay... YUM! Completely worth the wait! The food (I had a New Mexican scramble with a chocolate chip pancake and fresh squeezed OJ) is absolutely amazing and the staff is extremely friendly and quick. They have indoor seating along with a great patio area. My husband and I cleaned our plates and will definitely be back for another breakfast in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9A8E3BBQ2hbiPVRztaaQ9g.text: Best breakfast in town! Don't miss out on the protein pancakes and the skillets are delicious too!  Be sure to use the yelp app and get on waitlist.

3RqVnIdleGP240hvuMIarg.text: Amazing food. I've been here several times and it never disappoints. They were a accommodating to our group of 11.

DYhqOgldikLmV0scybekUQ.text: Butters was fairly good. Not anything too amazing though. I'll start with the good. Our server, Ally, was very sweet and pleasant! The barista beverages were super good, my friend and I both got the iced white chocolate mocha! Their pancakes are so good, I got the banana cream ones, which were only a $1.50 up-charge from toast. My friend got the wild berry pancakes which were also very delicious. Two of us got the popeye scramble which was okay, nothing special, and 2 others got the Hog skillet. The food took less than 10 minutes! So awesome.  Now to the things I wasn't crazy about. The "over medium" eggs on one of the skillets was NOT over medium, pretty much over hard without the yolk broken, basically solid. Both the scrambles had barely any bacon, and something I thought was strange was that they scrambled the avocado INTO my scramble... totally an opinion but I wasn't crazy about that. Everyone agreed that all our egg dishes were just okay, nothing special. The best parts of our meal were our drinks and our pancakes. Speaking of the pancakes, although the up-charge is small, and they were delicious, the pancakes were tiny!!! Probably only about 3 inches across. And lastly, I really dislike how much paper/ plastic they waste here. All their barista drinks are served in to go cups... which isn't good for the environment. And the butter for the pancakes comes in a paper cup as well.  So yeah, not amazing. If you come, I would stick to pancakes. Fairly good food though!

zoxHUefeiGand8d3mhlPbA.text: We have eaten here many times and this place is the BOMB! The protein pancakes are addictive and most of the meals I have had here have been truly satisfying. Highly recommend

MnCVhFoSyo_hkKNpTWNWSQ.text: Amazing. I'm not a breakfast person, but this may have changed that! Definitely worth the wait, the portions are relatively big...the pancakes are DELICIOUS! Can't go wrong with Butters

ZuRjkj3QuF4SJFEsItdAow.text: Don't miss this place for breakfast.  Great selection and the Blueberry Danish pancakes are AMAZING!!! Service is fantastic.

OkMumrgrLzonc9G4xpZhIQ.text: The banana bread French toast is worth the price of admission!! It definitely made up for some small hiccups all around.   Even at 9a, there was a 45 min wait for a party of 6. Luckily, it was a nice day and we were able to run some quick errands while we waited. I really liked how they took down your phone number and sent you a text (and called) when your table was ready instead of giving you a buzzer.  The server seemed a bit overwhelmed by all of us, and forgot a few things here and there (milk for the hot tea, a set of utensils, napkins), but she was pleasant enough. The food came out quickly and was hot and fresh. The coffee was great and she came by often to refill it.  As I mentioned, I LOVED the banana bread French toast. Literally banana bread dipped in batter, then topped with pecans and bananas. Delicious!! The eggs were fluffy but nothing remarkable. I sampled the cheese grits and they were super cheesy! I also sampled the Oreo pancakes- way too much going on there for me. Too sweet, too many toppings.  Price point was fair and I enjoyed my experience. Especially that French toast!

JgSF7IFYSAY0ivTRNIBZ7g.text: The food was AMAZING! Not like your typical IHOP or Denny's. It tastes much better and so "home-made". I highly recommend the omlets (they burst with flavor) and the pancakes (they are crazy soft and fluffy). Our first server was very rude just because we "inconvenienced" her to move to a booth AND they were not even busy or anything. But our second server made up for it. I wish I remembered her name cause she was the best and so sweet and gave us great recommendations. I love this place and their food. It's also very cute inside!

qbej4v_clrR3Pl8p3kP_9g.text: When I visit home Butters is always on my list of things to do in Phoenix! Breakfast is my favorite type of food and every time I come here I have a hard time picking out one thing since it is all delicious! I have had the salmon scramble, eggs rojo, and the famous pancakes. All of them have been delicious and counting down the days till my next visit home

RyTfiuUVleFRyJ_eLIhPsA.text: Came here on a frosty Saturday morning. A hot cup of Joe with some fresh squeezed OJ and a hearty breakfast skillet hit the spot. Service is outstanding!

0YGU0T9cPdavnDI6n3aqCw.text: Expected more of this place, to me it lacks better flavor and presentation. Seems like an old diner, didnt care much for it. Bad bacon too, they need to get better bacon. Not worth the price sorry.

xEME8-0wMg_N-k579CCmMA.text: Great place. Only bad part is waiting to get in. Long waits. Dishes are fresh and delivered rapidly. Great service. Everything is good. No bad meals!!

T8s8eB-y7ir8MbPj8yAYmA.text: Bottom line - Best pancakes I've ever had! I went with the wild berry and had an out of body experience. I don't even know where I am. Usually, with most pancakes, I have to douse them with syrup and spread butter all over. These were so perfectly golden brown and had all sorts of sauces coming out on top and everywhere in-between. They were heavenly! And the service was speedy and exceptional!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild berry cakes - ordering them is a must!

SA5NEPiKi3rCMfAC6R5b1w.text: Stumbled upon this place through yelp and I'm so glad we stopped in. I got the veggie skillet and it was so good!! The staff was very friendly and I will definitely be back again!

4Z6HtWRTNK_bmrUnSTwapQ.text: Amazing pancakes and the scrambles were fantastic too.  You will wait a little to get in on the weekend but worth it!

mdSfAprn00ZRlqhgvmh1mA.text: This is one of the best breakfast places west of the Brooklyn Bridge.  Friendly service, interesting menu, everything seems to be made from scratch and is reasonably priced.  The place is sparkling clean and very comfortable.

X8e2B5I5taI5GotkEXWtPQ.text: Bad service!!! Manager name Antonio is rude. We originally have 8 ppl. Table .  Then we have 2 additional pp come to join us.  There is 1 table for 2 available right next to us.  He will not accommodate for and ask us to go back and put us on the waitlist for 10 plot started over again.

A6eXp7Rm4hZhsqX0eYm4ww.text: I had a long layover in PHX and met some friends here for breakfast on a Sunday morning, we lucked out and even with the hostess getting the name wrong for our party of 4, we were seated in about 20 minutes. Food is good stuff. The service is what earned this spot a 3. They are pushy, they want you in and out and want to get the next customer in. I get it, you are open limited hours, you get enough customers on the weekend to demand 30+ minute wait times. This does not allow you to rush your seated customer. Disappointing. Don't go here thinking you'll be able to enjoy your meal on your time, you are on their time, and they will be sure to let you know it.

PfARN5lT7KHkLnmhsEP4yA.text: Great place for breakfast. Gets busy some mornings so best to do the check in online before arriving.

PdCI2dLxPzbhks3S75GnbQ.text: Love the wide selection of menu choices. Like that they offer a electronic wait list too  We had a particularly nice meal and a great sever, Ali, who went above and beyond to accommodate everyone's requests

k057y94P9aEJiX4pLhrQ2A.text: Came here with a large group a while back and let me tell you. It was a Sunday and they weren't very inviting to our group in the beginning until we all arrived on point. I was trying to be seated slightly early because I had a broken foot and it's triple digit heat. I was able to get a chair outside to sit in at least after asking. My experience with the renowned manager was extremely negative to the point I told the other person I seriously didn't want to talk to him anymore nor deal with him. I didn't really care he was known. Blah blah blah. How he treated me was what I experienced was very poor. The food was good but seriously they need to rethink how they treat  groups. Don't remind me it's Sunday! I know it is. We all wanted a Sunday brunch! Duh! Our group was of respectful caliber and wished we were treated as such. Global travelers are generally going to be more reliable and set a higher standard for an establishment especially if we are bringing in a large party. Please don't judge every group on a few bad experiences and declare to us we are going to be bad and not have our group show up because you have had bad experiences in the past. That is like me saying I'm going to have a bad dining experience because I had one at a different restaurant. Not ok. It was clear they wanted us in and out in an hour which was slightly rude especially when the checks came so quickly and wanted it squared away. Food was good but not worth the headache of the staff and reminders of it's a busy Sunday. We know and it was the only time we could all get together. Ugh! Frustrating place. Poor customer service.

gjPag7nOJTr4yxaq1gjPng.text: Love this place, ok is amazing.  I haven't had a bad meal or service there. I would recommend this place, get there early on the weekends, as it tend to have a long wait.

94whbue6M65M6pBh7jo5yw.text: I'm so bummed this isn't a good review because I had high expectations for this place. I've been following them on Instagram for a while and it's been "must try list".   First. There was a 30 min wait. Which is totally doable considering it's a Saturday morning. They informed us they would send us a text when our table was ready. 30 mins later no text. We went in to get an update and they said they called our name on the intercom. We were outside because it was crowded inside. We didn't hear anything. And there was no text. The front desk person kept making eye contact with us. That wasn't the best first impression. But we were willing to let that slide.   Second. Upon being seated we wait literally 15 mins u til someone even asked for drinks. The server walked by multiple times and not even an acknowledgement of our existence occurred. What did it for me was when a couple was seated next to us, and they received instant service. Even after that, we were still ignored. Finally the server got to us, but only to ask for coffee. I would have been fine if she apologized for the lack of service due to rush hour, but not even that happened.   Most likely won't be coming back because due to lack of service. It's unfortunate because I really liked that Instagram page :(

4NMPKbUX3f1l2_b-APOxzg.text: We sat on the enclosed patio which was much quieter than in the main room. The coffee was delicious as well as our meal. We will come back again.

yIGLs44hASibdJWiJpwedw.text: We came today for our first time.. it was full so we sat outside but the misters made the patio cool. The pancakes here are to die for!! The service was great, and we can't wait to come back for more cold brew

GQFlDeLZPt9TccaYObCw_g.text: I went here during the week and it was a little busy, but chose to sit outside, which was perfect with the heaters on! Highly recommend Butters for breakfast; so delicious, and you get a lot of food for your money.  I can't even imagine how busy this place gets on the weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BZohskouj9ww-WT_4OOAjQ.text: This place is a gem, don't tell anyone the wait times are long enough. We went in a Sunday and waited 45 minutes. The wait time is much shorter on weekdays and Saturday.  The staff is very friendly, the prices are reasonable and the food is excellent. Fresh squeezed orange juice, skillets and plenty of fresh brewed coffee. I have found that skillets are hard to find the area but this one is one of the best "the meat lovers".  This restaurant needs to be on your bucket list!!

7GMHatYKzzGHNkpfZWwclQ.text: Yummy. Great coffee. Classic breakfast, elevation notched up just a tad to stay like a hearty diner breakfast, but in a nicer atmosphere and better ingredients and options. Bacon - perfectly cooked, IMO, hard to do. Service was spot on, comfortable, in and out, not feeling rushed at all even though the place was packed.

KUrefQBgmrXJmqiRw68C8Q.text: The food is excellent and the staff is very attentive. The portions are the perfect size. You get a full breakfast without the over stuffed feeling. We had the berry stuffed French toast and New Mexican skillet. Both were so good. Loved coming here and will be back soon!

fFsA6-XxsXe-7pHhBdKK4Q.text: This is a solid place for breakfast! Good food. Fine service. Butters has what you need. I will return.

iLzGjxOQTHqht_OBzdl_6Q.text: I've been to Butters multiple times, and every time is a great experience! The food is always delicious! Staff is very attentive! You have to try the signature pancakes! It's the way to go!    Tip: Skip the long wait times and get there anytime before 10am- if you can! After 10am is when it starts to get super busy. You'll be waiting at least 45minutes before your table is ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll Cakes!

BznFVAbZ4NLuxDmAqgXN8w.text: Yum!!! This place was fantastic! Great food and reasonably priced. We went back again so we could keep trying the different flavors of pancakes! They bring real butter to spread on them too! I also had the scrambler, which was full of yummy things, but not potatoes! Most places use potatoes as filler, but not Butters!  They also have some of the fluffiest eggs I've ever had! The service was friendly and delightful! Definitely recommend!!!

s2obqE0CPweEUGIqa5d8dw.text: Since they've moved I've noticed the staff is not quite.....as engaging?..... as they used to be. Now shoved into a smaller, differently laid out seating arrangement it seems as though..... well.... they don't.... engage.  My waitress walked by me 3 times before I guess she either saw me or realized I was her table. I mean after seeing me the second time she could have asked.... have you been helped? The food is still good... but when you feel like you're not being attended to or the servers demeanor is one of..... hey I just take orders and deliver food.  I mean this goes for the front of  the house also. I walked in and they like stared at me for about 6-9 seconds. I'm like.... helloooooo. Maybe it's the increased noise level.... got them all unable to focus. Industrial noise and hiring people unable to work with it. Plates, people, clanging, etc....  they definitely seem to be zombies. idk.  While I used to look for reasons to go to Butters.... now it's just on my mediocre list. What used to be a great place to enjoy with outside seating, the water fountain outside, busy exciting place..... now.... it's like a STEPFORD Butters....... PLASTIC. Just sayin

axw9k3boIbIaOnq7J3DNow.text: Need a whole hearted breakfast, then this is your place. Had to wait for about fifteen minutes but the plaza is really nice so it's a nice walk.  Started the morning with a good ole fashion coffee. Feeling adventurous I had the New Mexico skillet. The potatoes harsh had chorizo and tomatoes. It was topped with the fluffiest eggs I have ever had and avocado. This dish was light but hearty at the same time.  The whole hog skillet had bacon, sausage and had in the harsh and topped with their fluffy eggs.  This dish was surprisingly not salty considering it had bacon, sausage and ham in it. This was a great dish.   The blue berry pancakes were dessert for breakfast.  Each cake was filled with a lot of blueberries and between each was a whipped mascarpone cream.  Heavenly!  Staff was very attentive!

Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild blueberry pancake
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New Mexico skillet

s4R46vp4y82vjdzu2gzo3g.text: Place wasn't too bad at all. Food was pretty solid I can see why the local community would love to come. Great lighting, outdoor patio eating area looks nice too especially when the weather is a lot warmer.  Upon arrival there was about 5-10min wait which I was told be a host after she had a moment to look up from her cell phone. I told her it would just be me eating and they offered me a seat right in the front of the house, I declined and asked for a booth and she told me I would have to wait again, which was no problem. Lucky a booth became ready right away and another host quickly sat me in a more comfortable location.  The service from Alexandra was beyond awesome! She was very professional and attentive even helped me with the menu and explained everything perfectly. She checked on me several times and even made sure my food came out perfect! I even noticed how she entertained they table next to me and I must say her customer service skills are very impressive.  I ordered the "whole hog skillet" not a bad option at all very good! But for pancakes to be a staple her I just expected them to taste a lot better. Not saying they weren't good but far from great. Next time I'll order French toast lol.  Will comeback, hopefully I can get lucky with the seating and service again BC this places looks like it can get very busy.  PS I paid $5.28 for orange juice, YIKES! I understand the have a juice bar/cafe in the front and it's prolly super all natural but my whole meal was only $11.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pancake options

FRN48yFyvME7ZnTT9zFLYQ.text: This place was good. As soon as we sat down we got coffee. We ordered our food and it came really fast. I am trying to lay off of "the meat" so I ordered the garden scramble with no eggs and no cheese. I added avocado, peppers and black beans. It was delicious, delicious!!! I would love to see more vegan/vegetarian options on the menu. Even without them they made an excellent veggie scramble. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

K_M9IKcLi2iyebWQrAAWxA.text: My families favorite breakfast restaurant in Scottsdale. The scrambled eggs & omelets are the best we have ever had.  The fresh squeezed juice is delicious. Usually a long wait on the weekends but worth the wait !

Fr23ZzgaQbG7WuPAR3mjFQ.text: We took my daughter & grandson (10mos) for an early Sunday morning breakfast. It was the first nice morning, weather wise, and would have been a wonderful morning to have breakfast outside. I have fond memories of this restaurant & dining outside when it was "The Good Egg". When we arrived we found out that we could not sit outside in the beautiful morning air because they didn't have enough servers. It would have been simple & easy to sit us outside and have one of the servers walk thru the doors to serve us. The way the restaurant is set up its just a couple of extra steps to the outside. Very short sighted thinking.  The manager was not very welcoming, never smiling or indicating that we were welcome guests as should happen in a restaurant setting. When ordering we requested something simple, like adding cottage cheese to scrambled eggs, in order to make it softer for the baby to eat. We were told that the "boss" didn't like to make changes to the menu but she would ask. They did end up doing it but when they brought it out, it was unbelievable, it looked like they'd added a whole pint of cottage cheese to one egg. They redid it and it was just okay. With all of the competition in Scottsdale you would think that they would do all they could to make a customer happy.  I probably will think twice about bringing my business back to this restaurant. This restaurant needs to work on their customer service & their attitudes. Their food is good, except for the pancakes, which are dry and fall apart when you cut into them.  Altogether a disappointing experience.

j-AiaEZZt9WIGTmmYrC7nw.text: This is my favorite pancake place in town! It's about 35 min drive from where I live, but well worth it!  The banana pancakes are heavenly, but you can't go wrong with the Oreo if you are having a chocolate sweet tooth craving.  I really enjoy the homemade Maple syrup.  Surprisingly enough we also LOVE the New Mexico skillet. It has green hatch chili's (real ones in AZ) very rare.  It's the right amount of heat/ spice.  No matter what I order a fresh orange juice & a simple, done right cup of coffee. The portions are quite large, so come hungry! Or even shareable (if you are willing too).  The atmosphere is adorable for a nice breakfast spot.  I have a doctors office near by, so I always make sure I make time to enjoy this amazing spot.  Friendly staff! Amazing quality food.

EXvG0V1OJpvg4IOYC8AsFA.text: Wonderful newer location.  The breakfast is amazing and larger portions are a great value. Very good prices and food quality.  Strongly recommend!!

4EDX2Zgei96br_cn1hjfNQ.text: Butters and Butterfields have perfected breakfast. I have been ordering take out for years but just tried their omelette for the first time today. It was the fluffiest omelette that I've ever had. Top notch service as well and the food is extremely fast to come out.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fluffiest omelette I&#39;ve ever had

q0FtjQBJXUq_LHLddTZP2Q.text: The fluffiest eggs on earth.  Enjoy an omlet cloud and add a short stack of cakes.    The coffee is delicious too.

VhGq92PJ0nP0x4QdwdLanA.text: Really good way to start the day. the mixed berry pancakes were amazing. the eggs had a-lot of flavor and the bacon was just perfect. No negatives . A+

Up-BixvkAadP-ZSJ5khe-g.text: I come here from time to time because I just love pancakes and French toast and this place is heaven on Earth for pancakes and French toast. It's usually fairly busy but they just moved into a new building which is much nicer and so it's not as loud which I like but I have to tell you if you want pancakes and your in Scottsdale this is where you need to go. Or of course if your French toast addict like I am this is also the place to go. So you gotta check this place out. I really do recommend it. the service is really good. the food is really good. definitely a can't miss.

JsnAFvLGUT89RToCi9J5LA.text: Delicious! Worth the wait for the berry bliss pancakes! This is our favorite breakfast place in Scottsdale.

nb6PcUXB3nN3JPO3eCuK8w.text: Busy eatery with about a 20 to 30 minute wait. A Chicago based chain that serves a wide variety of breakfast options with no accompanying gun fire. The Santa Fe Scrambler, laced with Chorizo and jalapeno, proved to be a filling and properly kicked up breakfast... no hot sauce required. The Banana Nut Bread Toast was highly recommended by our food guides (cousins). Being banana bread lovers, we had to share an order; also very good. I don't know where they get their bacon, but it was exceptional. I'm sure whoever orders their ingredients is a pig whisperer. A very good breakfast.. recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Santa Fe Scrambler
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Nut Bread Toast.
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tasty bacon... better than your usual porcine strips.

Hat2eHtbiE6u4wdWWvmIgw.text: Went to check this place out before I headed back home to Vegas. The place is very welcoming! As soon as my gf and I entered we were greeted and promptly seated.  I ordered the classic French toast with sausage and hash browns. My gf ordered the waffles with grits.  The French toast was fluffy and definitely melt in your mouth. I prefer crispier French toast, but these were still great. Now, I was not prepared for the side of sausages to contain 3 patties. Lol great surprise but with everything I ordered I couldn't finish everything. But they definitely give you what you pay for.   My gf said the waffles were delicious better then expected. The grits for her were different then what she's use too a lot more creamy. She liked them with sugar and butter. I had a taste and they were good.   The service was great  I don't remember her name but she has two braids on the day we went lol. Which was yesterday.   Oh! Almost forgot we has the smoothie and omg they are delicious! Definitely try either of them they were all great.   On my list to definitely come back to our next trip to Arizona!

8SppX5JeEyQPkkKAnz3KzQ.text: The wait is worth it and typically not more than 15 minutes. Food is on point for taste and variety. Service is friendly and the dining area is spotless.

1dvhdUD_7sdh60ykoCQb6w.text: We love this brunch spot! The food is great and staff is always friendly and attentive. The kids menu portions are pretty sizable for an affordable price. And the regular menu portions are huge,  if enough for sharing or eating on your own too. Helpful tip,  check in with Yelp to see wait times and plan your visit accordingly- showing up on the weekends wait times can get really long! We keep coming back because it's so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2 egg breakfast with pancakes
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qvZsEuuFUJwo6tUs92e5rA.text: Had the Oreo Pancakes which were three pancakes filled with Oreos and topped with Oreos, chocolate chips, and marshmallow fluff. That was delicious, but my side of hash browns were not, they were not crispy and didn't taste very good. So I'll probably opt for eggs next time as a side. Had a bite of their half pound house burger and it was pretty good.  They have a fountain by the patio which is lovely to look at if you sit on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The fountain right outside. :)
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My Oreo pancakes with a side of hashbrowns.
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Their half pounder.

Tz5JAfwcZs6GfqbyYaNkcw.text: This is a really great place to grab breakfast.  I like to come during the weekdays so that it isn't as busy as the weekends.  All of the portions are large.  My Mexicana omlette was delicious with a side of hash browns and a couple of buttermilk pancakes.  My girlfriend's eggs were cooked a perfect soft scramble, just like she ordered.  The coffee is also above average for a quick breakfast place.  It would have been nice if they'd had room for a counter/bar area so that if you're dining by yourself it would be more convenient and comfortable.

hDFPhzht-bRWNgzfDcQ3Iw.text: My favorite place for breakfast. I usually get the Mexicana omelette with extra green sauce but tried something new. I love the food here. It's quick, tasty and good service! They make fresh orange juice too and great coffee.  Pictured here is the Mexican skillet it was pretty good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FNPtzISupWyzKQaNT0N4xA.text: Very tasty, unique and high quality food. Great, clean and lively environment. I would recommend this for breakfast to please everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Cream Pancakes!!

9M_7ai2jOddGlOPmYs5n0w.text: Don't bring your service dog here.  The hostess with attitude will give you a grief.  Unfortunately getting attitude for your legal rights is simply pathetic.  I wanted pancakes not an attitude, I got the latter.  She said with an attitude; "I am going to get the manager"  I departed and will never go back!

M52bvoUWcd9EYheh6rMfkg.text: The server didn't know basic math and attempted to "save me money" by putting my order ala cart. Wow. Will not ever go back. The food matches that if Denny's, while the location is t bad the food and staff didn't make up for it. Best of luck to you Butters.

3ZLYFV8-5cekpBAZFzHjtQ.text: I'm glad I got to try this places. We waited a bit but not as long because I used the Join the waitlist feature for Yelp! Yay! Would definitely use it again. And I live how you can see your place in line.  Our server was great and I loved the industrial vibe of the place. They were definitely super busy but we got our orders in pretty good timing.  We started with some coffee because why not. I ordered a sugar free vanilla latte!! Whoa! So good! I also tried my friends chai latte.. also yummy!  I ordered the Popeye scramble and it was yummy.. maybe a bit more onions than I like but I finished everything. I upgraded my cakes to the cinnamon roll one and soooooo goooood! I love how it was not super sweet. They were perfect! Hasbrowns were also yummy! They did give my friend a lot with her burrito! So much carbs lol but so much yum! Great experience! Would come back for sure!

3VNMQuyJlYWL6wZBSA3H_g.text: Expect a wait any time you go but there's a reason for it. Fortunately, they're really good at telling you how long you'll wait because it's always spot on and always worth the wait. One time the wait was 45 minutes and we decided to try somewhere else and definitely regret it.   We've visited here at least a dozen times and the food quality is consistent and delicious. I love their poached eggs and hash. But their fresh squeezed orange juice is a must have. We've tried several breakfast joints around Scottsdale and nothing comes close to Butters.

TWbtx1vuuhEBXUbYNMf8Dg.text: Nice and modern open floor plan. We sat on patio and it was nice as well with misters on. Avocado toast with poached egg and jalapeno cheese grits was all yummy!!!!  We also had eggs and pancakes. I loved the pancakes and finished my daughters order. They were pretty sweet for her, but so light and airy. I loved them!!!

NwLCJUBGubk61Vpt0bIQfQ.text: I found this breakfast place through a list collection of "best places in the valley" and yep, it's amazing. Of course it's busy but if you plan it well you can make it in without an issue. I'm excited to go again when they open their new location!!  I had the eggs verde plate under their specialties menu which includes corn tortillas, black beans, cheese, 2 eggs, green chili sauce and hash browns. It was so tasty and perfect for what I want out of breakfast- not too sweet, not spicy and just the right mix of savory ingredients. Writing this makes me want it again BUT I'm determined to try their pancakes.  Waiting for my food I could see other tables orders and from what I could tell, anything is worth trying. The omelets looked massive, skillets looks fresh and amazing and then there was the pancakes... wow. I have to have these so that means I have to go back. Oh and the service?? Amazingly kind AND super fast, thank you!!!  It's a breakfast/brunch only but and early start to the day is worth it for this food. I took one of their cappuccino blast drinks (mocha flavored) to go and it made me so happy. I am excited that I found this place and it's a great recommendation.

q6jqg9XHInWCNNzZc-ZpBA.text: Great breakfast and service!! I recommend you put yourself on the waiting list if you're going Saturday or Sunday otherwise you will be waiting for a long time. Try the original French Toast it melts in your mouth the best I've ever had.

nhWdUPpEtIotVl5YzoF9pw.text: Well anything with the word Butter in it you know its going to be good!  This place is one of the best breakfast places in Scottsdale.  The atmosphere and the wait staff are awesome!  Butters has a wide variety of breakfast foods but what they are know for are there pancakes.  You really cannot go wrong with any of their pancakes but I would recommend the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes.  The pancakes are exactly that.  Just imagine a cinnamon roll in pancake form.  No need for syrup on this one.  The next pancake you should go after would be the Protein Power Pancakes which are wheat pancakes, blueberries, oats & almonds.  You get the light fluffy pancake mixed with the crunch of the oats and the almonds then the sweetness of the blueberries.  These will fill you up!  You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu.  The food here is well worth the wait, and trust me you will have to wait.  If you have to wait you know there is good food (great indicator of good food just sucks waiting).  So, go get buttered up!  BrandonFitFoodie

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Protein Power Cakes - wheat pancakes, blueberries, oats &amp; almonds

js8dmu5WRSDxtkzPPlgr7A.text: We came in Saturday morning. We had to wait for about 30 minutes. We didnt mind waiting outside because there was nice cool weather and we sat by the fountain outside. They conveniently text you once it's your turn in line.  We ordered a hog skillet and upgraded the pancakes for $1.50 to wild berry bliss pancakes. I ordered a classic eggs benedict and shared. The hog skillet had bacon and potatoes and eggs. The food was plain and it tasted like something you could make at home but it wasn't too greasy.  My wild berry bliss pancakes  looked picture perfect the  pancake itself was lacking. The marscapone cheese was a nice touch I did enjoy the fresh berries. The egg benedict was unmemorable and usually it is my favorite. I didn't care for the hashbrown which were sliced and fried like scalloped potatoes.   Verdict: This was a drive for us the patio seating was nice but there's better breakfast places out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild berry bliss pancakes

r80sjfAl_-HKSY1XNqwXKQ.text: We arrived about 10:30 on a Wednesday and they were very busy but the wait was only about 15 minutes so we decided to stay. I got a skillet and it was alright, the eggs were kind of rubbery. The service was extremely slow and our server seemed to hate her job. When she dropped off the food she quite literally "dropped" it down and didn't ask if we needed anything else. After, she only checked on us when we were almost done with our food and left us the check. Overall I'd give the experience a 7/10 but wouldn't come back, especially living on the other side of town.

WGxjeTUQoMdI7CPph25Ffw.text: very good food but always to crowded.  lines to get in.   dont bother on weekends you will never get in.

4BX9zqYD9CbGb8mizCYXRw.text: Walked here for breakfast and was able to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful weather. Everything was fresh and delicious. The pancakes were fantastic,as a side to breakfast was enough for a meal, or to share. Price was a bargain for the amount of food. Will be returning! Service was wonderful too!

Xb6AzEGM9FPApi2SdIAVpg.text: Have been to Butters at this location twice now. I have always ordered their buttermilk pancakes. I guess I'm a pancake kind of guy but, I just happen to really like their buttermilk pancakes and their service is great as well. Since I have not tried other items on their menu I can only give them a four star rating. Let it be known that this is based on their pancakes.

9H_Cdc1h5bM08dgiGsb_sA.text: This is a great pancake house. I actually want some right now thinking about it. The wait is long on a Sunday. Bring your whole party, otherwise, they won't seat you. I believe that oil it is pretty standard everywhere in this area. The only reason I didn't give them five star is because the bacon was soggy and dry and the eggs were boring flavorless. Pancakes are great though.

CwjX4E_ttroShxH_OwnAPw.text: Great place.  Wonderful pancakes & crepes.  Something about their bacon made it taste better than bacon normally does.  Wait staff was attentive and prompt and the hostesses were polite and welcoming.  Really no complaints about the place.  Will definitely stop by again next time we are in the area.

8WGc__EnoPncLkIHU-0Mjg.text: A classic breakfast spot, with a new contemporary twist thanks to the move across the street! Butters is da bomb, nuff said.

V4sHKpUnMCfdtDCRAVttsg.text: Cinnamon Pancakes were UH-mazing! Best pancake I've ever had and I've had a lot of pancakes!

PP0MuF8SNrjvytFwa_zqAg.text: BEST BREAKFAST WE HAVE EVER HAD! The wait is 100% worth it! Get the wild berry crepe or pancakes and definitely get the corn beef hash! The orange juice is fresh squeezed and the best orange juice I have ever had!

oFvSlC-qh834gB7wMOkq8w.text: Great place for breakfast. Very busy as most of the places we visited were this trip. I really loved the corn beef hash skillet and was large enough to share with someone almost.  The pancakes were ok but every taste is different. Plenty of really good choices that make me want to come back. Give it a try

4wg2sp-u3XTrzVgRM1O3WQ.text: You must go here. The food is amazing and the service is great. Our waitress, Halle, was funny and very knowledgeable of the menu and food.  Went here on a busy morning, but were seated within 15 minutes. Despite being so busy, Halle kept coming back to us to check on us. After we ordered, our food came out really quick!   The restaurant is clean and bright. Can't wait to come back when I'm in town next!

adMQh6USnoNdTegMqRWeng.text: Best omelet I've had in a while. Was satisfied with the hash browns and pancakes as well.  Friendly staff. Great ambiance and music. Overall a place to come back too. Lastly, good coffee too.   #foodcoma #atesomuch

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wPTnAaYNYmksR9H0OmK5eQ.text: Savannah was an amazing server she greeted us as soon as we sat down.  I had a caramel macchiato, build your own omelette and cinnamon roll pancakes. The food came so fast and the omelette was really fluffy. The wait was worth it!

OOaexEsk2tih6WCngvbeUg.text: Thank you fellow Yelpers for another great breakfast experience.  I drove here based on your reviews!    Service was good.  Menu had a nice variety including Gluten free options.  Food was good.  I highly recommend this place.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VWOFiJjI_tsJMaDRC-c9cQ.text: I love all Butter's locations and Butterfield's. Not once have they ever made a mistake and the food is always wonderful. I visited this location most recently. I love to get the Corned Beef Hash Skillet but everything I have tried I enjoyed. My boyfriend always gets the Whole Hog Skillet and loves it. This restaurant hits all marks from customer service to cleanliness. 5/5 stars!

NJ7_e2NVpe_Q2FbHRnTXGg.text: Everything is good. Pancakes are delicious. They give you a lot of food for the price. Best breakfast in Scottsdale!

cC-xmNBzMTSD9jzK0kq3Tg.text: Best breakfast place ever! Don't miss it if you're ever in Scottsdale! Can't wait to go back!

88yeB8RMEJu6ybxjzLEA7Q.text: This breakfast place was a short bike ride away from the resort I stayed at in Scottsdale. Their menu has all of the typical categories for breakfast. I ordered the french toast with a side of eggs and fresh squeezed OJ. I would definitely recommend it if you're staying in the area. Although there was a long wait to be seated, the service itself was quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brioche French Toast with Mixed Berries

QkrpidW4Ac99NH6-VM-5uA.text: Butters, can you open a location in the Bay?  Far and away the best meal I had during my time in AZ.  My only criticism is that the corned beef hash seemed like it came out of a can. Still, the corned beef hash skillet was very good. Otherwise, highly recommend the wildberry pancakes, and I believe them when they say the OJ is specially-made.

wHQUGH6944hNRB-s3BFgNg.text: When you get there you will find a great hosting experience right out of the box... The Lobby is often full and of people excited to eat. Expect a 15 to 45 minute wait to be seated... But don't let that stop you the food is worth the wait. The tables generally turn over fast with excellent professional service both out on the floor and in the kitchen. They provide both indoor and outside seating for your preference...   Butters is a great breakfast and lunch experiences if you are looking for a great place to eat in Scottsdale.   Enjoy   ~ Rob

xZXXhOb7M09_IlYXTfVN7w.text: Great breakfast spot.  I'm not big on pancakes but they were really good I had a fabulous omelette and the folks that work there were nice.

_yKc6-gvbNCITQ4zNFU_lw.text: This place is just pure awesomeness!! Absolutely delicious, I have been here a couple of times and I am never disappointed. I had the garden skillet and subbed French toast for pancakes. Food comes out fast, hot, and fresh, doesn't get any better than that. Eggs, potatoes, and French toast were all buttery goodness, hence the name. Anytime I'm in town I will make it a point to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Garden skillet w/ spinach, mushrooms, onions and cheddar cheese, with scrambled eggs. Subbed Pancakes for French toast. Super yummy!!!

Q2i7dQyHrjpEkP_UuAvWlA.text: Excellent food, phenomenal service!!! This place just took one of the top spots in my fav-breakfast-place-list (if not the top one). Even though the wait to get in was 25min, our order was out quickly. The food was delicious. I ordered the baked potato omelette, and it was heavenly. Everyone in our party loved their food. I will definitely be back as many times as I can (it's a bit of a drive, but SO worth it!) If you're a "breakfast person"... this place is a must!

mQ16VZvDvt7Fy6A3OMH_CA.text: Now I see why this place has 4.5 stars with 600 reviews. I don't know many other brunch places that can make ordinary skillets found everywhere into something extraordinary, and this place does it.  We got the California scramble with a side of chocolate chip pancakes and the New Mexico skillet with a side of regular pancakes topped with fresh strawberries.   The California scramble was a lighter take on a normal omelette, filled with grilled chicken, avocado, etc. It was fluffy and the chicken was moist! The New Mexico skillet was hefty, so do not get it if you're looking for something lighter. They gave a generous amount of chorizo and avocado. Both portions were good.   The pancakes were yummy! Their house made maple syrup was light but still flavorful compared to other places that taste thick and molasses-like.   The wait seems to go by pretty quickly, so don't get intimidated. It's big on the inside and can accommodate many customers at once for dine in. Highly recommend!

QOgT3NODPGL8DA8DRhJY5g.text: The place was packed on a Friday late morning. Cute place. I had the Marscapone stuffed crepes. Amazing. My waiter Antonio was good, even offering to give my refill of coffee to go. Nice touch. Why the 2 star review? Well, it would have been 5 stars, but the blonde food runner with a missing personality was continuously picking and wiping her nose without ever washing her hands. Super gross. I'll go back, but not if I see her working.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ibSgFTQmX9QFGV8q-yyTOA.text: This is my all time favorite breakfast joint on the planet. Food is just outstanding and the fresh sqeezed oj is amazing recommend the New Mexico skillet. It's amazing same goes for the farmers skillet.  Fish and chips take the cake to I recommend this place to everyone fun friendly and amazing food

AoXBXkBoO4XZ8guYDpC4TA.text: This is one awesome restaurant and the food is fantastic. Today Penny and I had their Classic French Toast and a Classic Waffle. The best! Next time it's the Eggs Benedict for sure. They looked fabulous. Out of all of the "breakfast" restaurants we've eaten at this is by far the best in Phoenix.  They do not accept reservations so we had to wait 35 minutes to be seated, but it was well worth it.  Gluten free items on the menu which can be a challenge for breakfast dishes.

UhHOwkwa1JkMfE3M6iRKZw.text: Our first time here!   It was okay.  They are super busy and bustling.   The waitress was efficient but not overly friendly.  The food was not as great as anticipated!   The coffee was excellent!   Overall just a 3 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Special pancakes,  wild berry bliss minus berries!!
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The 2 egg breakfast with special pancakes.

nfISx1KCktPIXinzsVojeQ.text: The fresh squeezed OJ is one of the best things I've ever drank!!!!!  My husband and I shared the mexican omelet and banana pancakes. Plenty of food. It was outstanding!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana cream pancakes!!!!!!!
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. OJ
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh squeezed OJ

xx_wYstIDlC62gyilH19tQ.text: Excellent food, excellent and very friendly service.  We went today around 1:00.  They were serving both breakfast and lunch.  I had the scrambler with salmon.  My husband had a salad. Plenty of food!  Great toast and fresh fruit, and eggs!  Also great coffee.  Would definitely go there again!  We went around 1:00 and there basically was no wait.

WXZRi23pf9FirGNcMhQfTg.text: Now I see why they have 140 reviews not recommended.. Im not smart shouldve read them and went to Ihop for crying out loud.. At least they follow instruction..

ULBzTrZqgdF3a-xYVWnI5A.text: Fantastic. Just fantastic. The best breakfast spot there is in Scottsdale. (And you can tell by the line!!) On Sunday mornings, be ready ti stand in line for maybe an hour. People love this place.   I have had their pancakes, French toast, eggs benny, and they are all fantastic!!!!! Personal favorites are the Country Benny & the protein pancakes. Also try their cheese grits & biscuits. So good!   You must go here for a weekend breakfast. But get there early or just plan on waiting a little bit. Not bad though if you're in a group.

wcSpBBg74TBasSFbVJSRxQ.text: Delicious...Service was great, food came out in a timely manner. Nice breakfast on the patio. Had the classic skillet and the corn beef hash skillet. Both were very good. Needed to go  boxes...see you next week.

a95FHCGLF214Fk9MyaSYUg.text: Standard breakfast and huge menu with nothing amazing on it.  This is a standard breakfast with a high price tag. Love the area though.

Vz3omeipP-6uGoGgXwPVjA.text: First timers. It was spectacular. Best hash browns we've had in a long time. Super tasty fresh squeezed OJ. Great service, spectacular food. You can not go wrong here. So glad we tried it. Great Yelp find!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oreo and Smores ... Wow!

7j7sf_4lowyvBD6iLC0x1g.text: The wait for a table on a Sunday morning around 9am was longer than 30 min but we got our food within 10 minutes of ordering and it was worth every second! Coffee was amazing, service was friendly and seamless.  I had the Mexicana Omelete and it didn't disappoint. It came with pancakes and hash browns. Totally worth it!

ogf9exccU2Cimhtc8hzxsQ.text: They do a nice job for breakfast. Pancakes and eggs are good. I like sitting outside on patio. It does get crowded, like most breakfast places, so go on weekdays if you can. We will go back.

2veUKZ02rEIZWBe_lkMTeA.text: The BEST BREAKFAST restaurant in Phoenix. The pancakes and the grits are second to none. When people ask where they should go to breakfast this is the first place I tell them.  The service is always pretty good and I've never had to wait longer than 10 minutes to be seated.

hTqyJDjEhhJbW3GFnviK_g.text: This was a very mixed experience, and if it weren't for the great service once I was seated there would be even fewer stars. Let's start with the positive.  I ordered a skillet that was pretty good, and my fiance ordered a scramble that was even better than my dish. We both got sides of pancakes which were really great. The syrup was genetic fake stuff which was disappointing, but the pancakes fluffiness made up for it. Coffee was constantly filled, and we left satisfied from the food...  However... The two hostesses we dealt with were clueless and rude. The one girl looked like a middle school student and quoted our wait at 25-30 minutes. We waited for 75 minutes to get a table. Missing a wait time by 15 minutes is acceptable, but missing by almost a hour is ridiculous. As for the other hostess we received a complementary order of smug. Apparently this girl had a large case of disinterested before coming into work, and was one of the least friendly and helpful hostesses I have ever dealt with. Despite good food and great service once I sat down, I would be hesitant to return based on my wait, rude hostess, and side of smug with my breakfast.

xYTE4lnZie60mwQyrQJfig.text: Here we are back in Scottsdale a year later and the first place we go for breakfast is Butter's. It is absolutely as good as we remembered!!  We are in town for 9  days and plan to have breakfast here multiple times.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New Mexico Scramble with Wildberry Pancakes an Cheese Grits
Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Santa Fe Skillet with Wildberry Pancakes.

YBGZpg3M74iYOSuVV8Pynw.text: Love this place! Great menu and great service. The location is great and the interior is super cute. Just get there early or you may have to wait!

K9MUjIxELcbBxsvN0OKY7w.text: Me and my wife were here recently to have breakfast while on our vacation to Grand canyon. We chose this place after we found it on Yelp with very high recommendations. We went there early around 7:30 am. I ordered Chorizo sausage egg Scrambler (i think it was called California Scrambler) with hash browns and Iced Caffe Mocha, both of which were amazing! Food was really yummy!. There is ample parking in the compound. I think the place is open from 6 am to 2 pm everyday. I would definitely go back!

c6_fbPgKwSobkrjCcnGlBw.text: Just last week a tourist that was in the same meeting as mine raved about his breakfast here one morning.  I had not heard of the place but decided to take my brother there who was in town for the weekend.  Ok, we get there and find out that they are a hot spot.  We arrived around 10 am and had to check in with the hostess, were given a light up vibrating table ready device.    The predicted 20 minute wait was accurate.    1 star for nice food, but not the great to die for pancakes we had heard about 1 star for nice service, no pressure to rush, well managed. 1 star for meeting our breakfast needs with a nice ample breakfast menu.  But I have to say my guest said it well - " this is not much different than The Good Egg or any other breakfast chain."  I think he was right.  Next time we will stay downtown and head over to Matt's big breakfast.  PS:  the place is huge for a breakfast joint - indoor and outdoor patios.  Expect lines on a Saturday.

7EPB4apVFzN-87FfED9LpA.text: So far haven't even been seated yet. We knew it would be a wait and that wasn't much of a problem for us. The kicker on this one is when we arrived to put our name in the hostess (who I am pretty sure is 12) was clearly flustered and irritated, looked at us expectantly and said "yes?" Not hello, how are you, welcome, how many? But "yes?" Strike one. We were told 20-30 minutes.... We have been waiting for 30 and were just told it would be another 20..... Hmmm.... Maybe you should learn to round those numbers up dear. Another young lady has now joined the infantile hostess with an ever worse attitude. We were clearly bothering her by asking how much longer our wait would be. Again, no smile, no welcome, didn't even offer us a glass of water on this steamy Arizona morning. Hopefully we will be seated soon and hopefully all of the food reviews are not a lie and my morning will be saved.

5QPOjxx5qHmPacoN9-v6kw.text: Tried the Eggs Rojo and it was delicous! My daughter loved the Mickey Mouse pancake and fresh squeezed orange juice. So many delicous choices to choose from. We look forward to coming back next time we visit AZ.

4Rp5uRUYtS1-9fWKmcps0w.text: Danny, the FOH manager was so rude to a lady checking (in a walker, probably sound 70yrs old) her status on the wait time, that I had to step in and tell the Danny, that the lady understood the situation. He then immediately verbally jumped on me and started being extremely confrontational and rude. He then even said, "oh your not talking to me now," because I had turned my back to him. He left and then returned wanting to bring the conversation up again. It was the most unprofessional situation that I have been a part of, and I worked in the restaurant world for 7 years.

6TZ6F6mYe8sjZOl9Gil9Dw.text: I have been going here with my fiance and we absolutely love it.  The food is fantastic.  Last week my whole family and I went there for Easter brunch and we had a really bad time, (we didn't mind the 40 mins wait, after all it was Easter)our waitress  was VERY rude. After all we went through we decided to give her a tip over the 10%,because the food is honestly really good, and when I turned around to say thank you she didn't even look at me and poured all the syrup on my head.   We told the manager and we really hope they do something about it.

nAoxlie4oCB-BA7WcUGNzQ.text: This was our first visit---and our last! All 5 of us ordered lunch. Chicken salad sandwich, mediocre , French dip , average. Biltmore chicken sandwich , no flavor, unless you count the paper from the cheese which was inadvertently  left on the sandwich! The waitress said "oh sorry "! Later we asked for the manager and told him about the paper. His reply was "oh, I heard about that". I feel he should have come over as soon as he was told by the waitress and apologized. He did offer to remake it, (too little, too late). They finally did remove it from the bill . Not looking for a free lunch, just a good one.

3eb7BHXaJG314QSInET0jg.text: Place is AMAZING!  Food is great, service is great, and atmosphere is delightful.  Everything is fresh and their restaurant branded syrup is so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Syrup

DHiMPu7prWoaUbxS6zIX1g.text: The best breakfast I ever did have! The food and service were top notch. And the outdoor seating was the icing on the cake.

8sluBCz2ILyvtBCsF3M9cw.text: We had breakfast here two days in a row if that is any indication of how good the food is.  We were staying at Scottsdale Resort and I have come to realize after staying in numerous places that if you want a decent meal you do not eat hotel food.  I found out about Butters from Yelp and the good reviews and we were really happy with it.  They have great waffles, french toast, and fresh squeezed oj in a chilled glass.  They give you a nice carafe of ice water on the table.   The service is great and all food is delivered quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Butters Pancakes & Café - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best fresh squeezed o.j. In a chilled glass

-BtJZz1lCxnxbmrGZ9-NFA.text: Orange juice was excellent.  Food bland.  Big puffy scrambled eggs that needed salt.  Left most on my plate.  I don't get it.

10_HMlu0S8hm4ZhG7315mw.text: This is one of the best breakfast restaurants ever. Service is outstanding, staff is friendly, excellent quality of food and endless choices. Have had several items on the menu and each was outstanding. The only problem is that as you might expect they are very busy but they manage wait times well. Will always come here when in Scottsdale.

G9N1j0sDZ_4Bzr0vuwbNbQ.text: OMG!! The most delicious breakfast that I've had away from home! Service is excellent and fast, and the place is super clean and comfortable!

WG50YgyevmScx1l1Ft37Yw.text: I have nooooo clue what the hype is all about with this place. There's an hour long wait to sit in what looks like a (slightly) refurbished Denny's. And the food is about the same quality as well.  To top it off, the service isn't just weak, it's downright terrible! When we were seated we waited about 10 minutes just to have our waitress come to our table, and when she got there she didn't even smile. She just said "what do you want to drink." I mean, at least fake that you like your job when you have a customer-facing role.  The prices are good, but then again, nobody's going broke at Denny's, either. What I will give them the three stars for is the fact that no one in our party ordered the place's namesake. Pancakes are their thing. They had a ton of variety on the menu, and if I ever went back (not likely) I would definitely go for the pancakes. The extra star is basically just my way of giving them the benefit of the doubt. I'm so sad I didn't like this place more. Oh well.

_ItA5Q10ggXWp7qggaPiMw.text: Food ad service and fast and sweet!!! Be sure you're not in a hurry,  the wait time is long- the food is delicious

q9PwW128O-IxkVQZt3t7yg.text: My favorite breakfast joint in Phoenix, hands down!  I don't usually like omelettes but the omelettes here were amazing. Pancakes were awesome, service was great, and the whole family loved it. We will be back many times in the near future!

SC3crAj7gdR-5tJ6sEZ1Gw.text: The bartender at our resort recommended this place for breakfast. It was a quick /easy walk and soooo worth it. Delicious pancakes and great scramble. Staff very nice and helpful and food came quickly and hot.

8JXuqU5xcwB0O-C9TsXPLg.text: Delicious. Food was great and there was plenty of it! The specialty pancakes were ridiculously good, our waitress was so kind and patient with my three indecisive children, and the prices were very reasonable. We will be back!

rjCw6aDoZ0Py65h3p44faQ.text: Very clean. Fast, friendly efficient service. This place draws quite a crowd! Went for breakfast on a Friday morning and the place was buzzing. Not so much that we didn't get seated right away but when we left that wasn't the case. There was a line at the door. For good reason. The food is very good. I had the veggie omlet and I agree that this is one of the fluffiest omlets I've ever had. I also ordered grits and they are better than most. Very creamy, flavorful and not drenched in butter.  My friend had french toast and said it was also very good. Will definitely go back when we are again looking to have breakfast in Scottsdale.

AfROTqmsLf3h0jyNMxI2Wg.text: Excellent pancake options. Outdoor seating has a nice atmosphere indoor very nice as well. Good coffee, great service and food. Busy, be ready for a wait but I would rather have that to get to great food and service.

4ONwHNDL0537jvcHvgJddw.text: Butters used to be one of my favorite breakfast places. Great food and great service! however i have started to notice the quality of the food starting to decline which is such a shame. I got the smoked salmon platter and it wasn't as fresh as I would have liked. This has happened to me probably twice. I also got the eggs benedict and it was super runny almost as if it was barely poached. Although I used to go to butters a couple times a month without complaint these incidents were my most recent visits to butters causing me to second guess my choice of going back.

6lo_XRRuqZbr3tK17D1ROw.text: Delicious food but long wait to get a table (I was here on a Saturday for brunch, of course) When we did sit, food came fast and service was good! Must have the pancakes!

r6BYGcZWI-QUTPtz3bF3dg.text: Honestly, I'm not sure why this place has so many good reviews. I went here Sunday morning with my girlfriend. We have been anticipating the opening of Butters because it is right across the street from us and going out for a late breakfast always makes for a good time on a lazy Sunday morning. We went around 10am and there was a 20 minute wait.  Not a big deal because I expected it.   We finally got called inside to get seated and getting to our table was like trying to find a seat on a crowded subway in Boston. This place was JAM PACKED with tables. Every seat in the place looked uncomfortable just due to the fact that the table next to you, was basically breathing down your neck.   We got sat in a booth (thank god) and took a look at the menu. We were asked, within a minute of sitting down, if we were ready to order. We said we needed some time to look, but she literally came back in less than 2 minutes to ask if we were ready again. It gave us the feeling that this place was just trying to get people in and out as fast as they could. My g/f asked what the creme anglaise was that came on the french toast. The waitress looked confused and said "Um, I'm not sure but its like a sweet sauce". Really?! At least offer to go find out. We rushed to decide and I ordered a veggie omelette with hash browns and pancakes and the g/f ordered the pumpkin french toast with the "sweet sauce" on the side.   The food came out fast but was nothing special. I took a few bites of the omelette and it was probably 90% cheese. I didn't even see a mushroom or zucchini in the few bites I took and the eggs didn't taste fresh. I pushed it aside and tried the pancakes. Maple syrup was definitely not real and the pancakes were dry and chewy. Hash browns are just hash browns. I didn't try the pumpkin french toast so I won't review it but she said it was just ok. About halfway through my omelette, the waitress puts the check on our table and says to have a great day like she was done with us. I hate when places do this.   I've literally had better breakfast and service at Denny's. I won't be returning.

EPPCXWXwyBW5dHpIs0Sayg.text: I've been here twice and the food is good - I had the skillet breakfast both times and my husband had the chocolate chip pancakes, which are also good.  The reason why I'm giving it only 3 stars is because they seem to really "nickle and dime" you....it's right in the heart of Scottsdale, so I suppose they think they can do this to people.  The prices are already a bit high for breakfast...breakfast food is pretty inexpensive to make, but most meals on average are around $8 or $9 a plate.  If you want egg whites, it's like a $1.25 - who charges extra for egg whites?!  If you order a side of buttermilk pancakes and want a few chocolate chips thrown in - that will be $2.00 extra - I can almost buy an entire bag of chocolate chips at the grocery store fo $2.00.  My neice wanted whip cream on her Mickey Mouse Pancakes and I think that was $1.00 or so extra....see what I mean about "nickeling and diming"? - not too smart in this economy.    Like I said, the food is good, but seems very pricey.  I honestly don't see this place staying in business....especially as long as the previous tenant Le Peep stayed in business in that location.

3f_ehjMowUAym8A_bY2fqw.text: Just visited Butters and it was just OK,  didn't really experience a "wow factor" as others have indicated.  Would try it again and order something less ordinary then just an omelet.  My bench mark is a place called the breakfast club in old Scottsdale. everything i have had there so far in the last year has had a "wow factor", try it.

99UIp6lu9Ma3NYJ-IosPlQ.text: Good food, good service. Small dining room with lots of table crammed in. You WILL get to know your table neighbor. Wait is SUPER long though.

fAV7px2o7OtlrpNJ2pqr7Q.text: I have been to Butters on numerous occasions - the latest being with three senior golfing friends from out of town.  Over the last few years, we have tried numerous breakfast places on their trips, searching for a breakfast that would satisfy all of their different tastes.  After trying six or seven different places, I brought them to Butters, since it was on our way to the golf course.   We all ordered something different, including a skillet, bacon and eggs, pancakes, and an omelette.  The service was fast, and friendly. In fact, we have one picky eater, who always sends his bacon back, because it isn't as crisp as he demands.  The waitress handled his grumbling very nicely, and even had him laughing about it.  The atmosphere is somewhat trendier than Butterfields, which was a very big plus for my senior friends.  They also commented on the friendly service, and the reasonable prices. It didn't surprise me that when it came time for breakfast on the final three days they were here, they all voted to come to Butters for breakfast.  It should be noted that we came on the weekdays when it isn't as busy on the weekends. I have been in the area on weekends, and it always appears that there is a waiting line.  The only thing keeping it from more stars, are the hash browns.  They are obviously prepackaged (or at least taste that way) - and a real breakfast place should have signature hash browns.  But all in all, a nice addition to the area.

2r7CrwEx1xD6Mt6c7YauiQ.text: I owe them a review as we eat there often.  The bad is that there is always a wait.  Yesterday was about 40 minutes.  The good is the great breakfast food and service,  They have a wide variety but main staples are omelettes, skillets, pancakes, and waffles.  With many varieties of each.  Yesterday's service was not fantastic and that was unusual.  I love to go there on nice days and eat on the patio.

IexR7BhveX6h38qNKOoPhw.text: Fabulous food and attentive staff. When our order wasn't quite right, it was gladly replaced with a 10% discount. Impressive.

JLxd1IM_V6uEHFfJHBNDFg.text: Every time we go the food, the service, and the leadership of the establishment is top of the game.  Great food each time we go.  We need to get a Butters near Desert Ridge.  We pass by a lot of places to come see you guys.  Thanks for having the best breakfast and lunch around!

Ij2ZIPDVw1fxRaAWoy3R5w.text: We came here on a Saturday and there was no wait. The reviews, and menu on the website all looked promising.  My hubby did not like their coffee at all. Tasted like the burnt Starbucks coffee.  He ordered the Fish and Chips. Homemade tartar sauce was a little on the sweet side, fish was ok and the french fries were not seasoned. We have had better.  I ordered the Prime Rib French Dip with a side of fruit. The bread was ok, the prime rib has a pretty good flavor. The dip was bland, almost like broth out of can. Side of fruit was really small.  I think they did a great job hiring someone to write up their menu and design the interior. But the food could use some fine tuning. For the price, I was expecting a little more flavor overall.  Probably will not go back again.

lcwtuI-wVzixeE0O2IoGxA.text: You can't go wrong with banana bread French toast and a side of fluffy eggs. My first time visiting and the service was prompt. If I'm in the area, I'll definitely stop by.

Gbr4JmrMwYRvkw9UgadxKQ.text: I love the location because it's bike riding distance from my house.  The food isn't anything Denny's doesn't provide and well "I don't eat at Denny's ever; okay ever sober and exclusively in the hours of 3am-5am.  That all being said the food is fine, service was slow and all things were done with attitude (been there twice and had the same experience with different people).    Finally... I called on Mother's Day to see about getting our name in and/or finding out about the wait- went something like this.  Me: "Hi I was wondering how long the wait was or if I could put my name in for a table." Butters dude: "We don't take reservations."  Me: "Well how long is the wait?"  Butters dude:  "Well it's mothers day!"  Me "Okay thanks I didn't know that..."  Well of course I knew it was Mothers day that is why I called!  Ended-up at the Spotted Donkey! Have been there twice since and well it's close.  If you can walk there fine but save the gas!

7BAT4xsZbK2utsZgYUZFIQ.text: Busy little breakfast place. Everyone I went with had savory breakfasts and they were very good. The sweet stuff looked good too. The coffee wasn't great, but they have a full specialty coffee menu as well. The service was lacking, but the food made up for it and I'd go back!

OtRGBqQOKgv6bv0pzWaSOQ.text: Very good place. yes waiting was a bit long.The breakfast was excellent, service staff was very professional and efficient.I'm definitely going back

omIDDrrYs_xV5U4Ck6c3_w.text: The food here was absolutely delicious! And the staff was beyond excellent. I had a Nutella crepe and my parents and Home went. The crate was made perfectly and the omelette light and fluffy. Our coffee cups were never less than half full and the staff bent over backwards to anticipate our needs. If I am ever back in the Phoenix area again this place will definitely be high on my list. I was thoroughly impressed with everything about this establishment.
